name: Museum of Illusions Las Vegas
description: Enter the fascinating world of illusions where nothing is ever quite as it seems. Visit us at Museum of Illusions Las Vegas and experience the unbelievable!
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3716 South Las Vegas Boulevard The Walkway Between The Cosmopolitan And The Shops at Crystals, Las Vegas, NV 89158
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 7 min walk

top_reviews.title: Hidden Gem that Blows your Senses in Heart of Vegas Strip
top_reviews.review: A true hidden gem inside the glitter of Vegas strip. Right in the heart of Vegas strip near Cosmopolitan. A sensory and mind bending experience. Cost is very reasonable and fun for couples and families. You can purchase tickets in advance for $6 off or they have folks handing out promo cards at the entrance.

top_reviews.title: Great family visit for photo ops
top_reviews.review: My niece and nephew loved this place. Great place to take family and take lots of cool photos. Lots of displays to show how our eyes and other senses can play tricks on us. Very fascinating.

top_reviews.title: This is a fun museum to do something different and spend some time at. It has some really cool things.
top_reviews.review: We try to do different things when we are in Vegas. This museum is quite fun and enjoyable. It is a nice way to spend time doing something different. Cool illusions. I had a dun time and think you will also. Recommend for a few hours whether you have family or not.

top_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!
top_reviews.review: My mom and I spent an afternoon at the MOI while we were visiting Vegas for a week in December. It was fantasticâwe didnât want to leave. It was well worth the price of admission. The exhibits were so inventive, and I loved that we were encouraged to take pictures by the staff. And speaking of the staff, they were amazing! Randall, Will, and Lucy were outstanding, and we had so much fun getting to know them. I hope we can visit again the next time weâre in Vegas.

top_reviews.title: Great fun and fantastic staff
top_reviews.review: This museum exceeded our expectations and we ended up with loads of awesome photos from our visit. The staff were brilliant - they were so friendly and helpful taking photos for us. We were able to revisit some exhibits when we thought of new photo ideas. The Vortex is fantastic - you walk through a tunnel with spinning walls and think you're fine for a few steps then suddenly feel like you're on a capsizing boat and cling on for dear life (even though you're not actually moving). I think we did that exhibit five times! We visited on a Tuesday lunchtime and it was really quiet. I can imagine that if it was really busy it would get a bit annoying waiting for each exhibit but we didn't have that problem.

top_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
top_reviews.review: Fun for all ages! My boys, 8 and 14, and I did not have the Museum of Illusions on our to see list, but we are so glad we made the stop. They loved all of the illusions and the photo ops! Buying your tickets online saves $5 per ticket.

top_reviews.title: Fun Illusions & Puzzles
top_reviews.review: We decided to stop in when it started to rain. The museum is very interactive with photo illusions, visual illusions to interact and puzzles of varying degrees of difficultly. My teen and I enjoyed it. And Iâd say 1-3 hours depending on whether you take on more challenging puzzles. Mine spent over an hour just on solving the Hanoi puzzle. Worth a spot if you have time and like puzzles. Also, if thereâs someone handing out flyers at the door, it could be for $5 discount per person.

top_reviews.title: Real or an illusion? Go see the Museum of Illusions Las Vegas!
top_reviews.review: Loved this attraction! Staff member Alyce was great! She explained the exhibits and took my photos so that I would have photos of myself in the illusions. Two other Staff members helped me also take great pictures. The illusions are fascinating- it's remarkable how the brain chooses to "see" things. This is fun for everyone. And don't be afraid to go solo! The Staff will make sure you have a great time!

top_reviews.title: Amazing!!
top_reviews.review: My husband and I took our 2 sons to MOI Las Vegas last week and we loved it! The illusions were amazing and the staff were so helpful and kind and made our time there so much more enjoyable! My family had such a great time and would love to go again in the future!!

top_reviews.title: A family friendly experience with interactive displays.
top_reviews.review: A very fun place to visit for all ages. They offer a military/veteran discount, which is always a plus for us. You can buy online in advance like we did or there was a guy handing out coupons prior to entering if its a last minute thing. Take a lot of photos. Thrre is staff on hand to help at displays and recommend fun poses for some. Some of the interactive displays will blow your mind. Depending on how interactive you are, plan on staying at least 90 minutes to get through the entire museum. It was not overly crowded and we did not have to wait to get in or view displays. We had a great time laughing and watching others experience the displays.

name: Bellagio Conservatory & Botanical Garden
description: Brilliance abounds inside our breathtaking Conservatory & Botanical Gardens. The attention to detail is astounding. The passionate display of nature in all its awe-evoking glory - quite simply, sensational! Let your imagination wander as you assume a leisurely stroll amongst rare natural finds selected distinctively for Bellagio from all over the world. Admire the essence of every season recreated with exceptionally gorgeous plants, flowers and trees thoughtfully arranged to inspire full splendor
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd. S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 7 min walk

top_reviews.title: Two year old was amazed
top_reviews.review: We stayed here for our 35th anniversary and knowing our two year old grand daughter was gonna be here we upgraded to a fountain view room. We did not know about the Conservatory when we planned our trip but once we saw it we knew she would love it.....we were right! We watched as our daughter in law carried her in, the look of amazement was instant. All the colors and decorations amazed her, she kept pointing and telling us to "look look woooooowwwwwww" Even as an adult I thought it was beautiful!!!!! Just another wonderful thing about this hotel!!

top_reviews.title: A must see while you catch the fountains.
top_reviews.review: So beautiful - always in awe of this! Very disappointed in how hard it was to see the fountains because of the Formula 1 racing. Had to have my husband walk almost twice as far with a broken ankle, just so we could watch one song of the fountains.

top_reviews.title: The Conservatory in the Bellagio
top_reviews.review: The Bellagio Conservatory and Botanical Garden never disappoints. This time the display was 'fall' and the colours were lovely. We visited both in the day and at night and we preferred the night time ambiance and the low lighting which made everything look really pretty.

top_reviews.title: Never disappointed
top_reviews.review: Always stunning and beautiful. This is a FREE must see. The wonderful imagination of the individuals who come up with the displays for the Bellagio never disappoint. Each display throughout the year is always very colorful, imaginative, and a joy to look at. It would just be nice if parents would keep unruly children in check and not let them run wild. Check out the chocolate shop close by.

top_reviews.title: Awesome, disregard the other review, best one yet!
top_reviews.review: We enjoyed the current exhibit with the Fairies and Mushrooms, always a must see. I thought this was one of the best we've seen, ever. Yes, it gets VERY crowded but since we were staying at Bellagio we just looked each time we went by and went in when it wasn't too bad. Definitely more magical at night. Loved it!

top_reviews.title: The best of Vegas
top_reviews.review: We always enjoy the gardens at the Bellagio simply amazing! This is a must see Vegas experience. The gift shop is full of special finds as well! Spend time taking in the breathtaking splendor

top_reviews.title: Amazing flowers
top_reviews.review: Well this was excellent I must say. Located just back from the main reception we saw some amazing floral displays. It is was fairly crowded but we could still see everything. It's also a free attraction which was a bonus. Definitely worth seeking out.

top_reviews.title: A "Must do" when visiting Las Vegas
top_reviews.review: The Conservatory at Bellagio never disappoints. Changed every quarter, it is like a giant Rose Bowl float, with a theme and objects are made of flowers, shrubs, organic material. This winter the theme was "The Nutcracker" and it was spectacular. And no charge to see it. Great spot for pictures, but can be crowded, best to visit early in morning, or very late at night....

top_reviews.title: Beautiful but prepare for large crowds
top_reviews.review: The nutcracker tribute was absolutely beautiful. The only negative to the experience were the crowds. Lots of tourists walking about and not with the best manners. It would have been nice to stick around and take it all in as it was a beautiful display, but the crowds made us want to leave pretty quickly.

top_reviews.title: vacation
top_reviews.review: we were there in dec and they did the nutcracker theme. everything was beautiful. went went twice. one in the day and once at night. also got to see the chocalate foutain. also seen the dancing waters at night.

name: Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas Sign
description: The 25-foot-tall sign is located in the median at 5100 Las Vegas Boulevard South. The sign marks the classic start to the famous Las Vegas Strip. A small parking area is provided.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas Sign
address: 5100 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89119-3232

top_reviews.title: Tick it off your list
top_reviews.review: Utilise the Deuce Bus to get there. There is a stop either side so get off the bus, take your photo, cross the road, get on the next bus back to the strip. Donât queue with the other sheep, walk down the side and get a nice angle shot with a clear blue sky backdrop.

top_reviews.title: Perfect Place For A Wedding
top_reviews.review: If youâre gonna get married in Vegas you may aswell do it here! Married by The Little Church of the West, as people who were not bothered about a traditional wedding, it was perfect. And at least you get a free audience with the queue of people lining up for their photos taken!

top_reviews.title: Iconic Las Vegas Welcome Sign
top_reviews.review: An absolute must when visiting Vegas for the first time! Usually a long line, but if youâre not too concerned about taking picture directly under sign, you can quickly snap a few shots and selfies from off to the side without bothering anyone. Parking lot is small, but has open spaces due to the quick rotation of people. Alsoâ¦parking is free which is a huge bonus in Vegas.

top_reviews.title: Great photo opportunity
top_reviews.review: Go early to avoid the heat and the crowds. We bought a one day pass on the bus ($8) and got there by 8am. There was an unofficial photographer there who takes pics for you with your phone. Gave us good ideas for the best places to stand - worth a $5 tip

top_reviews.title: Yesâ¦.It certainly is a sign ðð
top_reviews.review: Yea, great photo opp! Not much else to say about that ahaha. There will be a decent amount of people there but it was nothing overwhelming, I believe my father and I went for about 10:00 and maybe waited 10 minutes. You can either take the photo yourself or thereâs usually someone there with Elvis or something.

top_reviews.title: Brilliant piece of Vegas history. A must stop for a selfie. Proper parking for easy access.
top_reviews.review: Massively popular sign you have seen in films and tv. Part of the history of Vegas. Great there is proper parking so you can easily get there by taxi or walk it if your hotel is nearby. Lots of photos. Good in day but best lit up at night. Popular place to go, safe and clean environment around. Popular selfie stop.

top_reviews.title: Itâs the vegas sign!
top_reviews.review: The vegas sign! Itâs a must see when visiting vegas, you canât visit vegas without coming here for a photo! Just donât get scammed by the rude men wanting to take your photo for money, who get short with you when you say no! Plenty of friendly people in the queue who will take your photo for you.. just return the favour for them!

top_reviews.title: Must have photo op at Vegas
top_reviews.review: Pretty hard to write a review on a sign, when it's just a small static object but, yeah. Anyway, don't let Instagram follow you, there's a big queue here most of the time for people wanting to take that famous snap. Good thing is the line goes down pretty fast and people are all very friendly, we got some other tourists to take our snaps. Also, if you want this sign, don't get off the Deuce bus stop that says it's for the sign as the one after (heading south) is much much closer.

top_reviews.title: Iconic Las Vegas Sign
top_reviews.review: A trip to Las Vegas is not complete without a kodak moment with the Las Vega Sign. There is a lot of symbolism with the design of the sign. It is a little south of Las Vegas but it is worth the trip

top_reviews.title: Nice stop but beware of the wait!
top_reviews.review: Site has a small parking lot and plenty of room for photos. I went during the day, early in the morning. Iâm happy we went around 9am because the line slowly grew after we arrived. There is an in-official but helpful person at the front taking pictures for you for tips. You donât have to use him or wait in the line if youâre fine taking your photo from the side. Very happy we went but I was very surprised with how busy it was so early! Consider taking a photo at the Harley Davidsonâs Las Vegas sign too! Itâs just a few steps toward the strip from the Las Vegas sign. No people and a cool photo too!

name: Gold Strike Canyon Hot Springs
description: Relax in one of the many hot springs along the trail.
category: Canyons Hiking Trails Hot Springs & Geysers
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: Purple Heart Hwy Gold Strike Hot Springs Trail, Las Vegas, NV 89005

name: The Gallery at Aria
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3730 Las Vegas Blvd S CityCenter, Las Vegas, NV 89158-4300
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 10 min walk

name: MystÃ¨re by Cirque du Soleil
description: MystÃ¨re is the original must-see Cirque du Soleil production that combines high-energy acrobatics and dramatic dance set to the thunderous rhythms of the TaÃ¯ko drums. Featuring an international cast of 67 artists, MystÃ¨re provides the ultimate discovery that life itself is a mystery. Emphasizing family-friendly, awe-inspiring athleticism and imaginative imagery, MystÃ¨re embraces all the signature Cirque du Soleil elements that have made this show one of the must-see productions on the Las Vegas Strip. Exclusively at Treasure Island!
category: Cirque du Soleil Shows Theater & Performances

address: 3300 Las Vegas Blvd S Treasure Island Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8916

name: Battlefield Vegas
description: We offer free customer pick-up and drop-off in a genuine US military HMMWV (Humvee) Also, we have a collection of over 600 machineguns from around the world at our 5-acre facility. You can shoot .50 Caliber Barrett sniper rifles, grenade launchers, .50 M2HB Brownings or even classic WWII Lugers, 1911's, STG-44/MP-44's, M1 Garands or even MG-42'. From the trenches of World War I all the way to the current conflict in Afghanistan, we have the weapon systems in our inventory. The property also has a military Huey UH-1C helicopter, M4A3 Sherman, "M1 Abrams" main battle tank, CH-34 "Choctaw" helicopter, FV432 armored personnel carrier, M2A1 Halftrack, Army trucks, Humvee's and various jeeps and other military vehicles for the experience!
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 2771 Sammy Davis Jr Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89109-1127

top_reviews.title: My best experience in Vegas so far
top_reviews.review: This place is just amazing. The officer who assisted us during the shooting was very gentle and made the experience extremely fun They have a huge variety of weapons We honestly had a lot of fun. If you want to experience real weapons fire. I strongly recommend this place

top_reviews.title: Well worth a visit
top_reviews.review: Fantastic experience from start to finish. We organised a free pick up from our hotel and were surprised to see that it was a military style humvee. It was a very cool trip to Battlefield Vegas. Once we got there, everyone was really friendly and Ryan was great at explaining the different guns and how to use them. Great experience and would totally recommend.

top_reviews.title: Adrenaline fuelled fun for a group of lads!
top_reviews.review: Amazing experience for a 1st time shooter! Staff were awesome in showing me how to handle and shoot various guns. Worth every dollar we spent, I shot 5 guns at a cost of $256. Glock Pistol, MP5, Ak-47, Remington 870 (shotgun) and Remington 700 (sniper rifle ) Was an adrenaline filled 30 minute experience and would definitely do it again!

top_reviews.title: A must do!
top_reviews.review: Absolutely fantastic place. My partner thoroughly enjoyed this. Good value for money we felt, and staff were extremely professional and helpful. Place is great, has a good little shop, and lots outside to go and take pics with. We would definitely return on our next trip.

top_reviews.title: A Must Do in Vegas!
top_reviews.review: A thoroughly enjoyable experience! The staff from the humvee pick up / drop off to the check in through to the range officers were extremely professional and made you feel safe throughout! A great selection of packages are available as well as being able to make your own individual package with a huge selection of guns to choose from. The grounds had a nice selection of tanks etc that you could walk around and visit whilst waiting. 10/10 would highly recommend for anyone visiting Las Vegas!

top_reviews.title: Great time, well worth the money
top_reviews.review: We visted Battlefield on the 10th October 2023 We didn't pick a specific package but created my own. All I can say is it was everything i expected and more. The instructor was professional and informative and we were made to feel comfortable throughout the day. I highly recommend this place for anyone and will definitely return on my next visit to Las Vegas.

top_reviews.title: Other activities in Vegas apart from the Casino's
top_reviews.review: I had organised this as part of a family vacation in Las Vegas. From the online booking site, pickup and shooting time it was a seamless, professional experience. Coming from Australia where we do not have access to these types of weapons I had elected the Black Ops package as most of us had used these in video games and it offered good value. To shoot them live helped put into perspective for those of us whom had not fired before the power of these weapons. To be collected in the Hummer and driven with music blaring was an experience suited to Vegas. The weapon instructors from the safety briefing to the shooting experience were professional and safety conscious at all times I would recommend this company highly

top_reviews.title: Shot for 20 years and still would go back in a heartbeat
top_reviews.review: As a UK Gun Owner I chose my own list of guns to shoot. Based on what is difficult to go shoot in Europe. The gun selection is vast, I was hoping to load/unload the guns myself but there was no way that was happening. There is NO messing about here. And that IS exactly what you want. I had a Jam or 2 but it's what well used guns do. It earned me a few extra rounds so I wasn't fussed. Because I was shooting more exotic ammo it cost a tad more. If you have never shot you can shoot quite cheep. Free ride in the hummer also worth the experience. Go check the tanks out before you leave!

top_reviews.title: The best!
top_reviews.review: Amazing from start to finish! We was picked up from our hotel in a very cool humvee truck with a very friendly driver, cruising down the strip in the back with some guns and roses playing will be a moment to remember! The range staff were all great, a shooting the guns was incredibly fun! The selection here is incredible including the museum of tanks! Get yourself a go with the desert eagle, you wonât regret it!! 100% recommended to everyone wanting to shoot!

top_reviews.title: Wow. What a cool morning
top_reviews.review: We started with a pickup in the humvee and it was neat. Once we arrived we worked out our packages. Staff were so helpful from the moment we walked in the door. We then moved through and did a combination of Platoon and Seal Team 6. There were four of us, two were not that excited but I tell you what, all four of us loved it. Range staff were awesome, so helpful, very professional and very safety focused. It came well recommended and very easy to see why. Afterwards we got heaps of photos outside with vehicles so that topped off the morning.

name: Flamingo Wildlife Habitat
description: The Flamingo Wildlife Habitat was established in 1995 and is currently home to many birds, fish, and turtles. It is an outdoor exhibit, free to the public, and open every day of the year. Viewing hours are 7am-8pm, and keeper talks are 10:00am. The habitat is a smoke-free area and handicap accessible.
category: Nature & Wildlife Areas Zoos Gardens Waterfalls
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3555 Las Vegas Blvd S Flamingo Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8901
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 3 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 3 min walk

top_reviews.title: Pleasant Oasis a Manic City
top_reviews.review: We stumbled across this when taking a shortcut through the hotel to avoid the 35c (95f) temp outside and enjoy the aircon of the hotel. The flamingoâs, ducks and koi appear to be well looked after. I fear the pelican has had its wings clipped to stop it flying away - it looked like it was trying to take off but couldnât.

top_reviews.title: Cute & educational
top_reviews.review: A great FREE & educational walk. This cool lush green wank is great for everyone at every age. Youâll see flamingos, pelicans, turtles, and beautiful, large Koi.I swear the Koi were posing for the camera.

top_reviews.title: I love flamingos ð¦©ð
top_reviews.review: My Dad and I were exploring the Strip one day and decided to check out The Flamingo. He told me itâs a classic but itâs a little dated and run down. We were NOT expecting to stumble into a wildlife spot with some really cool birds/fish. I absolutely LOVE flamingos and pelicans so this was a pleasant surprise for me and I enjoyed this area so much Iâm debating taking my fiance here to stay when I return! If that area looks this cool and beautiful now I can only imagine what it looked like during the âglory daysâ of this resort. I would definitely recommend stopping by here if youâre trying to kill some time before the next activity/show!

top_reviews.title: Peaceful
top_reviews.review: We were eating lunch nearby and brought friends to this hideaway to have a relaxing place to talk. We got lucky and were here during the educational feeding time. It was a wonderful and free experience. There are many varieties of fish, some turtles, an engaging pelican, and the stars of the habitat, the flamingos.

top_reviews.title: Flamingoes mean vacation!
top_reviews.review: Had a blast in this area! Flamingos are my favorite animal because I always joke with my family and friends that flamingos mean vacation! ð Enjoyed seeing the different birds and animals. I have read though that there used to be way more animals during its âhey dayâ, and I do agree thereâs some areas that felt a little bare and empty, but still a very peaceful, beautiful area with some cool birds!

top_reviews.title: Small and beautiful
top_reviews.review: Nice set up by Flamingo hotel, with a few flamingos, fish, turtles and ducks. Itâs not big, itâs not fancy, but itâs a good place to walk through and see something else besides casinos. There are good places to take pictures with beautiful backgrounds. Keep in mind itâs not a zoo so donât have high hopes. Itâs a 5 minutes visit.

name: Gold & Silver Pawn Shop
description: The filming location of the popular reality television show Pawn Stars attracts fans from all over the world and those looking to get their own items appraised. If you happen to swing by on a shoot day, you might be one of the lucky few cast as an extra on the show. In addition to antiques, collectibles, and jewelry, youâll find a section of Pawn Stars memorabilia. You can visit Gold & Silver Pawn Shop as part of a reality show tour that takes you to various Vegas landmarks that have made it big on the small screen. â Tripadvisor
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 713 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89101-6755

top_reviews.title: Pretty cool famous location and TV Show.
top_reviews.review: Stopped by on a weekday while in town. None of the cast was there. Souvenirs were available, pretty good size crowd, and just being there was cool. I planned on pawning some things just to have a memory and experience. Didnât pawn anything. Interesting items on display. Worth a go if you like the show or Vegas attractions. Bought a shirt and took some pics.

top_reviews.title: Reality TV Las Vegas Pawn Shop Review
top_reviews.review: The store was as I would have expected. It is a working Pawn Shop. There were several items from the show that had not sold yet and were really on the show. We expected that there would be souvenirs to buy, such as T-Shirts, etc. but did not really expect that there would be anything else we would be interested in buying at all, but were pleasantly surprised. We found one item that we liked. The price was near retail, but, when we asked a salesperson, we were able to negotiate a 25% discount. The item was very well wrapped up to avoid breakage. It is a fun place to visit.

top_reviews.title: Loved it
top_reviews.review: Loved the place everyone said it was really small. It was small but not like i was told. Employees were great and understood their roll that they are pretty much marketing for the place. They were very friendly and answered all my questions about the show. They also let you take pictures inside which i didn't think that would be allowed. Highly recommend if you're a fan of the show.

top_reviews.title: Great afternoon out!
top_reviews.review: This was a lot of fun. We were in the Arts District having brunch and then found our way there. It was bigger than I expected and fun to see cut outs of Rick at the store. The cast was not there but it was still cool. The real sleeper hit was Rick's BBQ joint across the parking lot!! OMG. It smelled like Texas in there. Everything was authentic and delicious. Chumlee also has a candy store there. He was there meeting everyone, signing stuff, taking pics- could not have been nicer. I definitely recommend the trip.

top_reviews.title: Pawn Stars fans - it's a must stop
top_reviews.review: I've watched the show for years and it's too bad the main three people are rarely there. But, I still nerded out over going inside and bought a T-shirt and Old Man bobblehead. It was easy to park, the neighborhood is fine and there was no line to enter. It is a smaller venue than TV shows, but it wasn't tiny and I got around fine. A lot of wall art for sale, not as much general items as hoped.

name: Nostalgia Street Rods
description: Come tour Vegas's Best Kept Secret. Do you love Ford's or Chevy's? When you book a tour here at Nostalgia Street Rods, youâll get access to a private collection of automobiles from 1910 to 1965. We also offer a large selection of memorabilia and antiques including signed sports memorabilia by Kobe Bryant, NFL Football Teams, Arnold Palmer and many more. Music memorabilia signed by musicians like Elvis Presley, Jimmy Hendrix, The Rolling Stones and much more! If you love hot rods and other classic cars, youâll absolutely love it here at Nostalgia Street Rods.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 5375 Cameron St., Las Vegas, NV 89118-2221

name: The Las Vegas Strip
description: Stretching for over 4.2 miles, the most famous entertainment destination in the U.S. showcases an eclectic collection of mega hotels and resorts, glitzy casinos, lavish shopping malls, and Michelin-starred restaurants. The best way to enjoy the Strip is to stroll down the avenue and marvel at free spectacles like the dancing fountains of Bellagio and the erupting volcanoes of The Mirage. Or rest your legs by joining an open-top bus tour that cruises down the boulevard. For a more adventurous experience, splurge on a luxurious helicopter tour for a birdâs eye view of Las Vegasâ iconic landmarks. â Tripadvisor
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Historic Walking Areas
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 3 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 7 min walk

top_reviews.title: Sensational
top_reviews.review: Absolutely wonderful, so many sights, sounds and spectacles. Despite being busy and a tourist hotspot I felt remarkably safe while here. Even when bucketing it down with rain it's a great place to be.

top_reviews.title: Viva Las Vegas
top_reviews.review: Viva Las Vegas! The people were really friendly and the strip has so much to offer, as does vegas. You may need a map to get out of hotels. Make sure you have enough time as we were so busy. Helicopter ride down the strip, Grand Canyon, zip line in Fremont street. Mj show was incredible. Please go to vegas.

top_reviews.title: LOVED IT
top_reviews.review: This was our first time to Vegas and we loved it. All the glitz and glamour was well worth the cost. We loved all the bright lights and stunning views at night. We found the strip very clean and any restrooms we used along the way were spotless as well. We were never annoyed by the entertainment along the strip, although some of it could be very loud which really wasn't necessary. No one bothered us. If asked "would you like a picture with me" a no thank you was enough for them to continue on their way. All stores and restaurants along the strip we visited were great. All attractions we did on the strip were well worth the money. All the freebies we saw were perfection. All the employees we encountered on the strip in different establishments were all very kind and very nice to us. They were always helpful. Hotels are definitely far apart and lots and lots of walking is necessary to get from point A to B. They really spared no expense when building all the hotels along the strip. Each one impressed us in many different ways. The Grand Bazaar in front of the Horseshoe Hotel is very seedy and really does not fit on the Vegas strip. We found the alley ways dirty and lots of unsavory people walking in there. This is the only place we as a couple felt uncomfortable along the strip. We noticed a fair amount of restaurant and bar construction going on along the strip as well. Shows that Vegas is thriving as a world class tourist destination. We never encountered any broken escalators inside or outside. Everything was in good working order and as I mentioned before clean. We did use taxis a few times during our stay and we found the cab drivers very unfriendly. They were very cold and sometimes even rude. All taxis were clean and air conditioned. The drivers just need a lesson in how to interact with tourists since they work in such a world class tourist spot. We always wanted to see Vegas and we can now tick it off our bucket list. We loved our trip and we made lots of great memories. Would we go back? We would in a heartbeat. We highly recommend seeing Vegas at least once in a lifetime.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful hotels
top_reviews.review: Beautiful hotels and so much to see and do. Many homeless people living on the strip and begging for money Finding a place to sit down in the shade is almost impossible. Free parking is available at Treasure Island

top_reviews.title: Strip
top_reviews.review: Coming from England and never having been to the states before, itâs overwhelming and unreal how huge everything is. Itâs busy 24/7 and the best for people watching. Every single walk of life gets here from the richest to the local character. Youâd never be able to walk the full length of it though - taxis are a must!

top_reviews.title: Worth the Stroll
top_reviews.review: The Strip is just that a strip full of restaurants, casinos and stores. We enjoyed the people watching and casino hoping. Once youâve been here, thereâs really not much else to do unless you gamble and want to catch a show. This was our second visit, we simply hit a few places we missed the last time.

top_reviews.title: Hustle Bustle, love it or hate it!
top_reviews.review: Busy, bustling, noise and lights, pretty much sums up the strip. I donât mean these things all negatively or positively itâs just the atmosphere of the strip. It had been nearly 24 years since I had visited so things had changed. The hotels are magnificent, great options for food and entertainment. The negative side was the obnoxious traffic, rudeness of people ( I am well traveled and this was the rudest environment I have been yet), pot smell galore ( eat gummies until your hearts content people!). It is worth the visit, just know itâs pricey to eat, drink water or soda. Plan a Walgreens trip to get water & soda for your room, $5-11 for bottles of water and soda when diningâ¦ food was a bit pricier than I expected. Over all the positives outweighed the negatives of the experience, thus the 4/5 rating. It is a unique city with lots to do!

top_reviews.title: I love The Vegas!!!
top_reviews.review: I was so blown away with my first visit to Vegas! Thereâs just countless options of things to do. Even if youâre not a gambler (which I definitely am not) thereâs still so much to do. I think Vegas has realized that the newer generations donât care as much about gambling as the previous generations so theyâve been trying to shift into more shows and entertainment. I donât even know where to start (check out my other reviews). The Big Apple Coaster was a blast, Stranger Things Store is a must-do if youâre a fan of the show, The Linq Promenade was a cool spot, and itâs just mind blowing walking through all of the hotels and casinos. Another great thing I didnât realize is thereâs amazing resorts for all kinds of budgets! If you wanna really treat yourself to a luxurious/expensive stay, then choose Belaggio, Mirage, Resort World, Wynn, The Venetian, Caesars Palace. If you donât plan on staying in the room much and donât wanna spend as much on your stay but still wanna enjoy a cool spot, then go Flamingo, Luxor, Excalibur, New York New York, Mandalay Bay. Every single hotel has something really cool and special to offer!

top_reviews.title: Enjoyed the Sites & Sounds!
top_reviews.review: We donât come here often, however highly recommend enjoying the siteâs & sound coming from the Strip! We like taking a cab if we travel too far, as itâs easier on the feet! Restaurants, shops plus seeing interesting ð¤¨ characters!

top_reviews.title: Great place
top_reviews.review: It is really hard to describe the strip, it is a great place with about anything you could want. The casinos/ hotels are all over the top and offer a different vibe. There is a lot to see and donât be fooled by the actual distance between places, it might look close but it can be quite a walk just from one to the next. It is a sight to see and really comes alive at night.

name: Little Church of the West
description: The World Famous Little Church of the West is the most iconic Las Vegas Wedding Chapel. We have been performing wedding and vow renewal ceremonies in our historic Las Vegas Wedding Chapel for over 70 years. In addition, we offer a charming Outdoor Garden Venue. Situated amongst pine trees on one acre of beautifully landscaped grounds, the chapel is located on the South end of the Las Vegas Strip, between Mandalay Bay and the famous "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign.
category: Historic Sites Architectural Buildings Wedding Chapels

top_reviews.title: Mall in PH
top_reviews.review: The shopping strip in planet hollywood. Not luxury like crystals in Aria. This one is more down to earth with lush, lululemon etc. And more fast casual restaurants like rainforest cafe, gordon ramsy burger etc.

top_reviews.title: Lost City show
top_reviews.review: Lost City show is great. Fire, water and lightning. It is near (outside not in) the V theater and best of all its free. Don't ask at the desk when you first walk in because they try to sell you something. Ask a guard or the reservation desk. Also we even asked someone at the V theater desk an they didn't know either. Luckily there was someone else standing by and they knew the times.

top_reviews.title: Well worth a visit
top_reviews.review: Well impressed with the decor as you got further into the centre it took a life of its own with the false sky and the themed buildings. It made it quite pleasant to be there. A wide verity of shops and places to eat as well as Gordon Ramsay burger bar, which we was sadly unable to get into as the queue was to bigâ¦..

top_reviews.title: Tons of shops and restaurants
top_reviews.review: Very nice place to get out of the elements for a bit. Tons of shops and restaurants. Also last couple reviews saying people were harassing them, we didn't see that. Yes some vendors would ask you about our stay but once we said not interested, they left us alone. Go to blondies for 3hr all you can drink special.

top_reviews.title: Conveniently placed shopping centre
top_reviews.review: A convenient place to shop and eat if you are staying mid strip. We ate at Ocean One, which serves Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner and is reasonably priced. We also went to the V Theatre to see Piano man ( Billy Joel/Elton John tribute band). A must see if you are in Las Vegas. At each entrance there are maps where you can find what you are looking for. At the time of our visit they were doing building works but that did not impact on the daily running of the centre.

top_reviews.title: Good spot to cool down
top_reviews.review: Came in to the mall to go to one of the restaurants. Lots of stores and restaurants available. The show that happens at the lagoon area was a fun surprise. This is a good way to cool off from the heat outdoors.

top_reviews.title: Convenient place for food, drinks, and shopping
top_reviews.review: These are such a convenience if you are staying at PH or a nearby hotel. Food, drinks, shopping, ABC store. Perfect place to find what you need. Many of the "cheap" eats are located here. But the food was still good.

top_reviews.title: Employees need to chillâ¦.
top_reviews.review: The Miracle Mile was great to walk around and escape the heat. Attached to Planet Hollywood, it was convenient for us to go down and walk around. There were a couple stores I liked there, Quay for example. However, the downfall was the pushy shop employees who basically followed you trying to give âfree samplesâ whether you wanted them or not. Also, there was at least two kiosks that had people trying to book trips for you. They too were overly aggressive. You had to bob and weave to avoid their aggressive advances. Totally turned me off.

top_reviews.title: Ok place - not hugely impressive
top_reviews.review: We visited here to attend V Theatre. Otherwise itâs not really a place I would have come into. Itâs quite large and has a variety of shops including ABC stores (everywhere in Hawaii and few other places elsewhere). The restaurant options werenât great for us. Overall it was ok

name: The Shops At Crystals
description: Anchored by more than 15 flagship stores, including Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Dolce & Gabbana, Tom Ford, Prada, Celine, Fendi and Tiffany & Co., The Shops at Crystals is an amazing collection of 50 of the finest luxury brands in the world, all under one roof. The gorgeous architecture, convenient location on the Las Vegas Boulevard, and exclusive luxury retailer lineup, make The Shops at Crystals a must-see for any visitor.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3720 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89158

name: The Atomic Museum
description: The Atomic Museum in Las Vegas, Nevada, documents the history of nuclear testing at the Nevada Test Site in the Mojave Desert about 65 miles northwest of Las Vegas.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 755 E Flamingo Road, Las Vegas, NV 89119-7363

top_reviews.title: Very informative
top_reviews.review: Very informative and well displayed museum. I also enjoyed the short movies presented in their theatres. The displays described the history of atomic testing very well. I came out knowing a lot more than I did going in.

top_reviews.title: Great museum - fascinating subject
top_reviews.review: I really enjoyed my visit. The exhibits are really well done. The coverage is surprising py in depth. I have learned about the Manhattan project elsewhere, but their coverage is first rate. The material you canât get anywhere else is the testing which is actually what was done near Las Vegas. This is also very well presented. The audio guide is OK but not great. There are plenty of audio-visual displays so you could really skip it. There are lots of related topics to learn about like waste&disposal, new efforts like NIF for non-explosion research. Good info about clean-up, too. I really enjoyed the info on nuclear rockets. Wow.

top_reviews.title: Grat place to visit
top_reviews.review: Second time here, and worth it! This place is a must see if in Las Vegas. It is conveniently located off the strip, with lots of free parking. The museum in indoors so it is climate controlled. Just some neat history.

top_reviews.title: Good museum with many of exhibits, films, and historical artifacts to view.
top_reviews.review: It also covers local history and the history of atomic weapons and energy. Since there is a lot of reading, as others have mentioned, you should bring headphones or earplugs to block out background noise and prevent distractions. It's a really charming little museum altogether, and the movies are excellent. Even though I was there for two hours, I was unable to read everything since it takes time.

name: Fashion Show Las Vegas
description: Fashion Show Las Vegas is a destination that brings the culture of fashion to life through never-before-seen experiences to locals, visitors, and fashionistas alike. Featuring an eclectic mix of more than 250 retailers and over 30 restaurants spread across 2 million square feet, FSLV is the largest shopping, dining and entertainment destination on the Las Vegas Strip!
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3200 Las Vegas Blvd S Ste. 600, Las Vegas, NV 89109-2612

top_reviews.title: Security and stall staff helping wheelchair customer. Kudos to you both.
top_reviews.review: Biggest kudos to the empathic young security who arranged for me to top up my electric mobility scooter, allowing me to reach my hotel. The young girl at the jewellery stall was an absolute angel for allowing me to recharge 20 min worth. God Bless you both. ððð. My only regret is I didn't get their names. Prior this, I had approached Starbucks, near Senor Frogs, they didn't allow me not even five min worth of power. One staff member turned his back on me.

top_reviews.title: Visited here winter 2023.
top_reviews.review: I visited this mall, after touring around the Wynn hotel, so was kind of tired by the time I got here, so rested here and there as needed. The mall is beautiful and spacious, and offered some stores that I went into, out of the many available to shop. Several ancho stores here. I spent a bit of time, trying to find the Mexican restaurant, for my lunch, and it wasn't in the food court. I had asked an employee, who had sent me to here, only to see it wasn't located here. I finally found some doors to go outside, and found it around a corner!

top_reviews.title: Great mall lots of stores
top_reviews.review: Alot of stores Stores are large. Easy transportation. Taxi outside waiting to pick u up. Alot of walking. 3 floors. Has hello kitty shop. Victoria secrets forever 21 dilliards Macy's Emerican eagle Erie. To name just a few. Souvenir store cheaper items.

top_reviews.title: Get some wadrobe staples here at great prices. Plus lots of Air conditioned walking space.
top_reviews.review: Great mall with "normal" pricing. This is like a hometown mall, but the stores have so much more. You can go to all of the regular mall stores here. The prices are good and there are usually sales going on. I currently live in a city without a mall, so this is perfect! I have gone to other Las Vegas "malls", but most have just a few regular type stores and a lot of high end stores that I am reluctant to even step foot inside. If you just need to buy a top or skirt (or shorts & shirt for a guy) to finish out what you packed, this is the place to go.

top_reviews.title: A great mall!
top_reviews.review: Lots of shops. Great selection. Hello kitty cafe made our teen daughtersâ day. Didnât get to see the entire mall but would love to visit again and spend a Longer time checking everything thing out.

name: Hoover Dam Bypass
description: The 2,000-foot-long bridge spans the Colorado River canyon. As the world's highest concrete arch bridge, it shows off spectacular views of Hoover Dam.
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Bridges Canyons
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas

top_reviews.title: Cool way to see the Hoover Dam!
top_reviews.review: We visited Hoover Dam 16 years ago and the bypass was being built then. We were excited to come back to discover that we could walk across the bypass and see spectacular views of Hoover Dam! Great job on the walkway up to the bypass and all the information about the construction of it. We would recommend checking it out when you are visiting the Dam!

top_reviews.title: This is where you will get one of the most iconic photos in Nevada.
top_reviews.review: You will need to get off the highway and walk out onto the bridge if you want a view. Heading from Nevada into Arizona, you couldn't see anything because of the wall dividing the east/west lanes. That's probably a good thing since people will gawk at it. If you do head to the parking area, be aware that it can fill up quickly. It is a tour bust stop, wo people show up in droves. The picture is pretty epic though. It's definitely worth the time.

top_reviews.title: A Windy Adventure with Historical Marvels: Hoover Dam Visit Review
top_reviews.review: My family and I recently embarked on an excursion to the iconic Hoover Dam, and despite some unexpected twists, it was a memorable experience worth recounting. The weather was windy, adding an extra element of adventure to our journey. Despite the gusts, we had a blast exploring the area together. However, we encountered a slight hiccup when we realized, albeit too late, that only service animals are permitted on the premises. Nevertheless, our husky seemed to relish his scenic walk, adding a touch of charm to our visit. We made our way to one of the many lookout options, eager to immerse ourselves in the rich history and breathtaking views that awaited us. Pausing at the lookout, we took a moment to absorb a brief overview of the dam's history, marveling at the sheer magnitude of human ingenuity and hard work that went into its construction. The panoramic vistas stretched before us, offering a glimpse into the past and reminding us of the remarkable feats achieved by those who came before us. From the towering structure of the dam itself to the serene beauty of the surrounding landscape, every aspect of the vista was a testament to human perseverance and determination. Despite the minor setback with our furry companion, our visit to Hoover Dam was an unforgettable experience filled with awe-inspiring sights and cherished family moments. It served as a poignant reminder of the importance of both historical preservation and enjoying the simple pleasures of nature's beauty.

top_reviews.title: The Best View of the Hoover Dam
top_reviews.review: This is the Highway 93 bridge that spans the Colorado River, but it has a pedestrian path that provides an excellent bird's eye view of the Hoover Dam, and it is probably the best view of this engineering marvel. It is also now known as the Mike O'Callaghan-Pat Tillman Memorial Bridge. You can walk to the bridge by parking in the lot off the Hoover Dam Access Road after passing through the security check. It does require quite a tough climb up steps from the plaza area to the bridge, but the effort is well worth it.

top_reviews.title: So much history
top_reviews.review: A must-see when in the area. Really interesting history and great views. There is not much in the way of facilities around so make sure you pack water and snacks before you head there. You can cross the border between Arizona and Nevada and also at the right time of the year you cross time zones.

top_reviews.title: Hoover Dam - May 2024
top_reviews.review: We visited Hoover Dam through Gray Line Bus Tours on a Thursday morning in May 2024.Â  Our tour guide, Michael, was the best, with non-stop jokes about Las Vegas, current events, and the tour we were about to embark on.Â  Michael was informative about what we were seeing as we passed by each stop, with exciting tips and facts along the way.Â  He made sure that each person was given photo opportunities at each stop and that we were greeted back to the bus with a warm smile and a cold drink (water.)Â  We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and would highly recommend this tour to anyone interested in seeing the man-made wonders of the US.

top_reviews.title: Great place to stop and view the Dam
top_reviews.review: Don't miss the Hoover Dam on your road trip to or from the Grand Canyon. This awe-inspiring structure is a testament to human engineering. A great place to stop for a good view is the Mike O'Callagan Pat Tillman Memorial Bridge Plaza. Lots of parking spaces here, though there's a separate toll to enter the area. Stretch your legs on the short 10min walk to the middle of the viewing bridge overlooking the Dam, snap some photos, and soak up the birds eye views before continuing your adventure. The bridge is even accessible with a huge ramp up to the top, just be prepared that it may be too much for those unsteady on their feet or for those afriad of heights. But we think it's a perfect stop on your journey!

description: Mega resort and casino complex combines fun and thrills for the whole family: Manhattan Express, a white-knuckle thrill ride; Boo!, a far-out cabaret performance; and Zumanity, another side of Cirque Du Soleil.

name: Las Vegas Downtown
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas

top_reviews.title: Lotâs to See & Do!
top_reviews.review: This is a city with lots to choose from the sites & sounds to fun shows! Lotâs of interesting places to see & great restaurants & shop till you drop! lol If you just want to relax at your hotel thatâs another option!

top_reviews.title: Nice to do.
top_reviews.review: Good fun to go downtown. Exceptional noise levels in Fremont street. Great fun looking at people. Rest of downtown nice to walk through. Of course looking at the well known shop. Bit of a walk from Fremont, but doable.

top_reviews.title: Louder and Grittier than The Strip but Offering an Entertaining Experience
top_reviews.review: Downtown Las Vegas is very different from the glamour and sophistication of The Strip. It is a grittier experience. It can be loud and filled with a younger crowd and you will encounter some interesting characters, but it makes for a fun time and is worth experiencing when in Vegas. Much energy was brought back to Downtown when the Fremont Experience opened. The Fremont East District adjacent is also worth exploring. It is a more laid-back area with bars, restaurants, comedy clubs and music venues. However, Downtown Las Vegas is also considered by many the "real Vegas". More no non-sense than The Strip. Hotels are more affordable, drinks are less expensive and table minimums at the casinos are less than The Strip.

top_reviews.title: The Bright City of Entertainment
top_reviews.review: It is so iconic and it is the main thing to do and to visit in Las Vegas. It is the worldâs most popular entertainment city, and the downtown is very bright at night. Most of the popular casinos are in the downtown and the imitate many popular cities and locations like Paris Eiffel Tower, Venice Canals, Caesar Roman Palace, Egyptâs Luxor, the Sphinx, the Pyramid, and New York.

name: Count's Kustoms
description: View cool paint jobs and a unique car collection belonging to Danny 'The Count' Koker, owner of the famous automobile restoration and customization shop in Vegas.

name: Bellagio Gallery of Fine Art
description: Bellagio Gallery of Fine Art is Las Vegas' premier exhibition space--where great art goes on vacation. BGFA is committed to presenting intimate exhibitions featuring works by some of the world's most compelling artists. Organized in partnership with museums and foundations from around the world, past exhibitions have included "Picasso: Creatures and Creativity," "FabergÃ© Revealed," "Painting Women: Works from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston," "Warhol Out West," "Figuratively Speaking: A Survey of the Human Form" and "Classic Contemporary: Lichtenstein, Warhol and Friends." Last admission is at 5:30 p.m.

name: Shelby American, Inc.
description: This location is our manufacturing facility and home of the Shelby Heritage Center. Visitors will see a wide variety of vehicles in the Shelby Heritage Center, from Cobras to Supersnakes and all of our current products. We also have a large merchandise store and tons of Shelby information available. Self-guided tours all the rest of the time during our scheduled hours of operation.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 6405 Ensworth St, Las Vegas, NV 89119-3211

top_reviews.title: Free to wander round and see some amazing cars
top_reviews.review: We got the Deuce (bus) up the strip to visit Shelby. If walking follow the arrow on the building along Windy Road to reach the entrance via the pedestrian friendly walkway. Once inside, just do the self guided tour and wander amongst some amazing cars and lots of info.

top_reviews.title: In love with Shelby Carroll's mustangs
top_reviews.review: I absolutely love mustangs of any kind. I was like a kid in a candy store. It showed the history of how Shelby Carroll started the company and how it grew. You can see mustangs from different years. You can even see into the work bay area where they do the tours. If you go make sure you can take a tour. We will be back so that we can take a tour next time.

top_reviews.title: If you like cars, please go!
top_reviews.review: There are 2 choices - you can go in and look at the cars for free. Or, you can pay ($59, I think) to take a guided tour - this comes with a gift bag with Shelby merchandise in it. We opted for the free tour. My girls had absolutely no interest in this, but hubby, son and I really enjoyed it! Beautiful cars. Great info. Totally suggest this! If you're not into cars, there are some benches to sit on while you wait - they are inside, so out of the weather. There is a shop where you can buy Shelby merch - t-shirts were $30, so not totally outrageous. And, I'd just like to say that if any of the owners of those vehicles (some are on loan) feel generous and wanted to let me drive one of these for a little bit that would be ok with me!!

name: Best Western Plus Casino RoyaleâCenter Strip
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
Best Western Plus Casino RoyaleâCenter Strip
address: 3411 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8955
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 4 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 8 min walk

top_reviews.title: Great value for money
top_reviews.review: This is one of the smaller hotels in Vegas and if you want glamour then this isn't the place for you, however, that said it was a good enough room with plenty of storage for our clothes, a kitchenette with a coffee machine, coffee pods, creamer and sugar, microwave, fridge and water, toiletries in the bathroom, hairdryer and iron. It was clean and housekeeping did an excellent job. The pool was quite small and basic but it was clean and fine. There was a room to print out our boarding passes or to do anything else we might have wanted to use a computer for, and there were vending and ice machines. The hotel was not expensive, had no hidden costs or resort fees and everything in our room was included in the price. There was a casino with a bar that was not expensive compared to other hotels, although the barman in the evening was extremely grumpy. There was an Outback restaurant on the premises which was nice, a Dennys, and a Wallmart. The hotel was in a good position right on the strip and in the middle of it all. The negatives were small in that it had a tiny reception area which meant always queuing for anything, and the room was a bit dark and had no outlook, but hey! Who goes to Vegas to hang out in their room?

top_reviews.title: Great Location on the Strip
top_reviews.review: I took a long time selecting my hotel for my trip of a lifetime to vegas, I didnt want a hotel that you had to walk a mile to get out of it and that was the reason I selected this hotel. Best decision I ever made, the hotel and pool are small but it was great, I walked down the stairs one way and was on the strip walked down another way and was in the pool, always had the pool to ourselves. The bar was well stocked with reasonably priced drinks, the lady was always around for our free drinks while gambling. Plenty of choice of food if I didnt want to go far. Staff really nice and always offered good advice. in the middle of the strip next to the big hotels (so glad I didnt stay in them) no resort fees whole holiday so cheap. Any bad review is from someone who didnt stay here just used it for gambling as it doesnt look pretty, but its clean had a fridge and coffee machine

top_reviews.title: Some pluses and more negatives
top_reviews.review: Great location and reasonable price. The room is quiet but the air conditioner is LOUD. Elevator was not working. Hallways/starways need cleaning. I picked up the phone in the room to ask a question and the cord fell out. Then I looked at the phone which was filthy. The tile floor in the room needs to be moped. The bed was HARD, but the pillows were comfortable.

top_reviews.title: Great service and great value.
top_reviews.review: We went here while staying in Vegas - excellent bar and amazing prices for Vegas. $60 for drinks in Caesars - same drinks $15 in Casino Royale. Bar staff were superb and service was second to none. It doesn't have table service as stools are around the bar only.

name: Las Vegas Motor Speedway

name: Madame Tussauds - Las Vegas
description: Millions and millions of people have flocked through the doors of Madame Tussauds since they first opened over 200 years ago and it remains just as popular as it ever was. There are many reasons for this enduring success, but at the heart of it all is good, old-fashioned curiosity. Today's visitors are sent on a unique, emotionally-charged journey through the realms of the powerful and famous. The museum-style ropes and poles have gone so guests can truly get up, close and personal with A-list celebrities, sporting legends, political heavyweights and historical icons, reliving the times, events and moments that made the world talk about them....

description: Las Vegas' only non-profit children's museum. The mission of DISCOVERY Childrenâs Museum is to provide a vibrant and engaging experience, through exhibits and programs, where children from economically and culturally diverse backgrounds actively participate in playful learning experiences that ignite a love of lifelong learning.

name: Binion's Gambling Hall & Hotel
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 128 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101-5604

top_reviews.title: A mixed bag
top_reviews.review: Early hours it's a bit rough, down-n-outs trying to avoid security and drinks service is often non existent. Later on it comes alive, has a good buzz and drinks flow freely. Good selection of slots, from old school to new and the players card is excellent, comps and free money build surprisingly quickly. Didn't get to try the steakhouse but the cafe is cheap and cheerful, and all our breakfasts were covered by the comps on players card. If you like slots then it's a good place to gamble and be rewarded.

top_reviews.title: Binion's!
top_reviews.review: The place inside looks dirty and old...but I love that! I would prefer this downtown casino over strip ones. I played video poker at the bar and the staff was great. Felt more at home at this place than the Strip.

top_reviews.title: The best downtown table games
top_reviews.review: We enjoyed playing craps at binions during our recent visit to Vegas. The dealers sometimes struggled to get the bets right but the pit bosses who sit at the table are 100% on the ball and make sure things are done correctly. Vince was especially great, he has a good sense of humor and keeps things moving on the table, no big delays between rolls. Compared to other casinos in the downtown, this was our best experience. We wonât play anywhere that charges for parking and appreciate that binions validates parking for players. We will return here every time.

name: Allegiant Stadium Tours
description: Experience this behind-the-scenes journey through Raiders history and culture, filled with surprises you could only find in Vegas.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3333 Al Davis Way, Las Vegas, NV 89118-3141

top_reviews.title: Great Fun Tour!
top_reviews.review: My daughter and I enjoyed our tour! So informative and amazing to walk all over the new stadium. Our tour guide was friendly and fun. After our tour, we were able to purchase nachos and given a free glass of wine. Then we were able to sit and watch the Las Vegas women basketball game. Too funny they were playing our hometown team, D.C. Mystics! ð¤

top_reviews.title: Best gift ever for a fan
top_reviews.review: If your husband is a lifelong Raider fan, like mine, this tour is a MUST! We skipped the after party but made great use of the discount at the Raider Image that came with the ticket. We were in absolute awe with the attention to detail taken with this tour, and with the stadium itself, of course. Check-in was easy. The tour was timed well, and even if you're not a Raider fan, it's awesome to see behind the scenes.

top_reviews.title: Tour was good but the overtime experience is a waste of money
top_reviews.review: It was fine but not great; 3.5 stars not 4. I guess if you are a big Raiders fan the tour might have been more meaningful. The stadium is new and nicely appointed. The overtime experience is a complete waste of money - donât bother. All it is is an open area with some simple games (cornhole, football toss, cup pong) and one free food item (stale nacho chips and sauce; a very basic hot dog) OR a drink. Not worth the extra $25 in the least.

top_reviews.title: Worth the price!
top_reviews.review: Had fun and got to see alot! Definitely worth the price of admission. The tour guides were awesome! Did not get to go onto the field due to a convention so I would plan to go a day that the field is open but other than that go for it you won't regret it!

top_reviews.title: Raiders stadium tour
top_reviews.review: We went in the tour as my partner is a fan of the nfl. The tour was fun, knowledgeable and the right length I have a bad knee and I kept up with the walking and its pace. It was great to see how the other half live at these games. Marny and Jeff were the perfect tour guides and we even saw a couple of raiderettes as well as having our personal one (marny) taking us round. An all time great way to spend a couple hours. .

top_reviews.title: Non-Raider Fans- Impressed
top_reviews.review: We got to go through the entire stadium including seeing the owners box, team locker room, the cheerleaders dressing room, and going on the field. It was a really fun tour my husband and I really enjoyed it. Even though we are not Raiders Fans it was cool to see all the behind the scenes stuff.

top_reviews.title: Fast, Fun, Informative.
top_reviews.review: What a great experience! The man at the gate revved us up and it was off fromn there! Got to see lots of things:The 3 Superbowl trophies, oweners box, field level, suites, locker rooms, etc. Our 2 tour guides were fun and informative. Tour flies by...75 mins gone in a flash! Wish we had longe picture time, the give you some, but they have a lot to do in the time you are there. Great history lessons from guide also. Highly reccomend this tour for raider fans especially.

top_reviews.title: Amazing Stadium Tour
top_reviews.review: Booked online and arrived an hour early before our slot as the cab was way early but no problem, straight in. Straight away from the parking lot you can see itâs a magnificent stadium. After our guide Chris had introduced himself and went as always in with the team supporters jokes, and they were very amusing. The tour throughout was very well organised and informative and made extremely interesting by our guide. Unfortunately we couldnât get onto the pitch as it was undergoing removal from the previous dayâs activities. We was informed of this before we booked. With plenty of picture opportunities and info gathered we finished our tour after about seventy minutes. Overall itâs an awesome experience especially if you visit from abroad and see how a great stadium can be. Definitely worth a visit

top_reviews.title: Incredible
top_reviews.review: This stadium looking incredible on the TV so I knew I had to go when I came over on holiday and my god, I was not disappointed. The views are insane, the tour guides were magnificent and the different angles of the field, behind the scenes such as vip suites, dressing room and bar areas were insane. My dream is to now go to a raiders football game and even a concert one day! If you're thinking about doing this tour, don't think, book it now because I promise you, you will not be disappointed

top_reviews.title: Drag racing fan
top_reviews.review: We went to the NHRA Drag races, then booked a tour for the Las Vegas Raiders stadium, was a real experience. Our tour guide was very informative, the stadium is very beautiful. Itâs worth taking the tour.

name: Fremont Street Experience
description: Located in downtown Las Vegas, this pedestrian mall spreads over five blocks along Fremont Street. Home to many casinos and hotelsâincluding Golden Gate Hotel and Casino and Binionâs Gambling Hall and Hotelâit's also known for jaw-dropping shows and fun activities, from free concerts to the 12-story SlotZilla Zipline. Come just before evening to catch Viva Vision, a light and sound show that takes place on the worldâs largest video screenâan LED canopy that spans 130,000 square feet. To make sure you don't miss any of the highlights, there's a variety of day and night walking tours available. â Tripadvisor
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Historic Walking Areas
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 425 Fremont Street, Las Vegas, NV 89101-5620

top_reviews.title: Definitely an experience
top_reviews.review: A totally different experience from the Strip but worth a visit. The overhead LED light show is amazing. Lots of cheap tacky souvenir shops and street performers (some good and some downright weird). The smell of weed is off putting but was fun to see.

top_reviews.title: YOU HAVE TO GO TO FREMONT STREET!!!
top_reviews.review: Iâd read a lot of reviews about Fremont Street that might have put me off. Me and my brother done the zip line which was amazing. There were bands, loads of nice people, the sights were incredible and we enjoyed it so much. Youâll see the occasional drug addict but Iâm glad I didnât let it put me off. GO TO FREMONT STREET!!

top_reviews.title: Fremont is sort of an experience.
top_reviews.review: To fully enjoy Fremont Street I think you need to suspend reality a bit. Itâs bright, itâs loud, itâs a lot! People watching is fantastic - so many people having a great time and enjoying themselves. The music is good - when we were there they had three bands in different locations and they all sounded great. The light shows are good. Some places have spots to sit on the street and enjoy a drink - recommend that! If youâre looking for a place to sing along to music, have some drinks and let loose, this is your place. Overall, 3 stars because it wasnât so much an experience versus a walk in a nest area. The use of tech is very impressive.

top_reviews.title: Maybe worth checking out
top_reviews.review: Lots of performers on lots of stages but that meant we didn't get to hear the experience we had wanted to hear - to hear the band we wanted to hear while watching the light and image display above. There are some things here to check out but lots of just hanging out. A ways from the strip, catch an Uber at a cheap time to make it worthwhile - not worth paying too much for the drive.

top_reviews.title: If you're in Vegas, you can't miss this!
top_reviews.review: This place has a buzzing atmosphere with lots to see. It is full of "interesting" people. Lots of street performers. But the live music and the cheaper drinks make it. The lights are awesome. The fact its pedestrianised really makes it as unlike the main strip, you're not having to worry about crossing crazy busy roads or hike up stairs

top_reviews.title: Busy and crazy. Not kid friendly.
top_reviews.review: Bus ride there from the strip is sketchy. Homeless and disabled everywhere. We took the Deuce bus there and it was over stacked with people. Homeless tweakers and weed smell everywhere. We ate at tony Romas while there. Great steak. We walked the length of the experience and back and decided there must be a portal to Hell located there and went back to the strip for a calmer atmosphere. Cops write tickets for jaywalking here. Use the crosswalks and obey the signs.

top_reviews.title: You have to go
top_reviews.review: The ceiling is a sight to see. The weirdest people come out. Youâll see Elvis and Michael Jackson. Weekend night is packed. Weed is legal there and I reckon you stay there long enough you will get high. Things are reasonable there . You have to visit ,itâs a must.

top_reviews.title: Visit Once - thatâs enough
top_reviews.review: Itâs a part of Vegas on your âmust doâ list - but only once. We visited during the day and there were enough odd-bods out already. Itâs too full of people trying to pressure sell cheap tat or beg for money. Even though it was day time felt unsafe and couldnât wait to leave. The lit up ceiling is impressive

top_reviews.title: Always fun just be cautious
top_reviews.review: Fremont Street at night is always a kick, especially for people watching. The light shows above are always entertaining. There are usually 3 to 4 life fans performing lots of interesting people walking around, trying to earn a buck off of you. And lots of just strange things going on. cautious for those who ask if you want to have your picture taken with them cause I will hit you up for money go have a good time enjoy but watch your back

top_reviews.title: Insane
top_reviews.review: The ceiling is impressive. The old casino fronts are nostalgic. Itâs a sensory nightmare. Lots of drink and drugs on the go, a lot of strange characters and homeless characters mooching about. You have to go and walk through it but hold your belongings tight.

name: Fountains of Bellagio
description: Every night, over 1,000 fountains sway and dance to music and lights on an artificial lake in front of the Bellagio Resort.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S Bellagio Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4303
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 5 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 9 min walk

top_reviews.title: What's not to Like!
top_reviews.review: Had the customary stop at the Fountains whilst in LV and in my mind the fountains were better than ever. Stunning displays and varied music accompaniments make this a treat for everyone. In such an expensive city, how can this free attraction not be the best thing going?

top_reviews.title: Absolutely stunning at night. Not bad during the day.
top_reviews.review: A sight to behold when seen at night. Not as spectacular during the day but it remains a must see when in Vegas. The beyond beautiful Bellagio resort is the perfect setting for this kind of set piece. Photos galore. Very well done.

top_reviews.title: Wonderful sight but was covered by F1 construction
top_reviews.review: Truly a wonderful sight. So mesmerizing. An obvious must-see while youâre visiting the strip! Just a shame that itâs been covered up by F1 construction so it was barely visible in some spots but obviously thatâs temporary. Hopefully the next time I go back Iâll have an even better view. At least they shoot up really high!

top_reviews.title: Classic Vegas!
top_reviews.review: Itâs a must see and one of the most fun things that are free on the Vegas strip. Check out their schedule online and go a little early to grab a spot where you can hear the speakers. The experience is not even close when you cannot hear the music.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful
top_reviews.review: The Fountains are in front of the Bellagio. If you have a room in the front you will be able to see them through the windows or the balcony if you are on a bottom floor suite. You can also see them, as most do from the street. It gets crowded and there is a set time that they go off. They are worth the wait, because they are just beautiful. They usually have music with them and the fountains appear to dance. The fountains are large and can be a tad loud, but you will be fine. They are fun and calming and cooling. You will just have the best time.

top_reviews.title: Absolutly Highly Recommend
top_reviews.review: The Fountains of Bellagio are an absolute must-see when visiting Las Vegas. This iconic attraction is a mesmerizing blend of music, water, and light, creating a truly enchanting experience. The choreography of the water jets is flawless, perfectly synchronized with an eclectic selection of music, ranging from classical to contemporary hits.

top_reviews.title: Enjoyed the Fountain Every Day!!
top_reviews.review: We stayed at the Bellagio for 4 nights & our room on the 28th. Floor had a view of the fountain. We watched the water show every day when we were in the room plus we turned on the TV enjoying the music during the water show!

top_reviews.title: A True Las Vegas Legend
top_reviews.review: A truly brilliant and legendary show of the Bellagio dancing fountains. Sadly we couldn't get too close to them as they were still removing some structures that were placed there from the F1 but we watched from the footbridge that leads into the casino itself. The shows seem to be every 15-30 minutes depending on the time of day but we watched them at night and they looked stunning lit up.

top_reviews.title: Never miss it!
top_reviews.review: A spectacular show set to music of a bygone age. Catch it at least once when I'm in Vegas and can't get tired of seeing it. Unfortunately, the last of a dying breed in Las Vegas. While the strip is becoming an oversized Times Square, lined with ugly high rises, the Bellagio fountain show survives as the symbol of the dying unique character that once was the Las Vegas strip.

top_reviews.title: Must see!!!
top_reviews.review: The Fountains of Bellagio in Las Vegas are simply mesmerizing. The choreographed water shows, set to music and lights, create a captivating experience that never fails to impress. Whether seen from the street or up close, the beauty and precision of the displays are breathtaking. It's a must-see attraction for any visitor to Las Vegas.

name: Casino at Excalibur
description: Our comfortable casino floor offers guests a chance to get into the action for a reasonable amount. Whether you are looking for your favorite classic slots or the hottest new games, Excalibur offers a variety of games from penny up to $100, which is sure to add to your entertainment adventure.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3850 Las Vegas Blvd S Excalibur Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4324
getting_there: MGM Grand Station â¢ 10 min walk

name: Mandalay Bay Beach
description: This is what being a resortist is all about. Voted by Trip Advisor as one of the best pools in the U.S. Mandalay Bay's world-famous aquatic playground features 2,700 tons of real sand, a 1.6 million gallon wave pool and 100 rentable cabanas, day beds, bungalows and personalized villas. The Beach is open seasonally.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3950 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89119-1006

name: Las Vegas Convention Center
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3150 Paradise Road, Las Vegas, NV 89109-9096
getting_there: Las Vegas Convention Center Station â¢ 6 min walk
Westgate Las Vegas Station â¢ 7 min walk

name: Las Vegas Monorail
description: The Las Vegas Monorail provides a quick and reliable transportation alternative for leisure and business travelers on the Las Vegas Strip. Directly connected to several Strip resort hotels as well as the Las Vegas Convention Center, the Monorail is the easiest, fastest and most convenient way to get from one end of the Strip to the other in just minutes. Trains arrive every few minutes at each of our seven stations: MGM Grand Station, Ballyâs/Paris Las Vegas Station, Flamingo/Caesars Palace Station, Harrahâs/TheLINQ Station, Las Vegas Convention Center Station, Westgate Las Vegas Station and Sahara Las Vegas Station. The system is open 7 a.m. to Midnight Monday, 7 a.m. to 2 a.m. Monday through Thursday and 7 a.m. to 3 a.m. Friday through Sunday.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 4 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 6 min walk

top_reviews.title: Awesome and Affordable
top_reviews.review: This was my first time taking the monorail in Vegas. I found that it was a really affordable way to be able to travel up-and-down the strip. The only downside was that it closed at 11:30 PM because of some maintenance that they had to do, so it made it a little harder to get home after some of the shows. I would still highly recommend it as affordable and flexible way to get around. I will definitely be taking it the next time that I come back to visit Las Vegas.
