Tip: Purchase the multi-day passes on the website to get a discount.

top_reviews.title: Las Vegas Monorail
top_reviews.review: The Monorail is very convenient and overall a really nice transit system, I wish they would invest in it more like an airport extension and even just connecting it to the STRAT would be nice. It's not like people don't wanna use the system, my ride was packed. Alot better then the current plan Las Vegas wants, Tesla's underground that carry limited people.

top_reviews.title: Okay for transport behind the resorts, but not for sightseeing
top_reviews.review: The monorail goes from the MGM (south end of Strip) to the Sahara (north end), with easy walking to the Stratosphere (not the best neighborhood though). But it goes behind all of the hotels on the Strip, which are pretty big, so by the time you walk from the monorail and walk back to the monorail, you might as well just walk to your destination if itâs only 2 or 3 resorts away. Itâs perfectly safe and clean. No random people hanging out because you have to pay before you get to the platform. Do not ride if if you are wanting to see out, as it is covered in ads that you can look out of as if you are looking through a screen. It is not that cheap, but if you get digital tickets they are cheaper.

top_reviews.title: Great view of sphere, difficult to find some stations....
top_reviews.review: The service is quick and reliable. Carriages are clean & even during f1, not over crowded. The stations can be quite a walk so be prepared. For example, excalibur to mgm walk to station is 15 mins. Finding the station from hurrahs/the linq (outside, high roller attraction etc) is really difficult, no signs and you need to walk thru car parks etc. Could be better sign posted.

top_reviews.title: Monorail is Life
top_reviews.review: I adore the Las Vegas Monorail it is so convenient for me as a resident on The Strip! I take the monorail for several occasions for work, shopping needs, and nightlife. It is two blocks walking distance and easy to access the Famous Las Vegas Strip, Las Vegas Convention Center, and sports venues on the South end of The Strip. It does not go downtown but you can connect to a free shuttle at The STRAT. It beats buying rideshares and taxis to every destination.

top_reviews.title: US transportation infrastructure already a museum piece
top_reviews.review: We thought we should check it out. All the stations need much better signage. Boingo has no direction sign from the sidewalk. Go into toward the Convention Center before trying the corner of Paradise. It's almost an historic ride. Only 20 years old and I think the Chinese metros in a dozen different cities would laugh their heads off. Anyway we had an interesting experience! And it was clean.

top_reviews.title: Monorail is the best way to travel the Las Vegas Strip
top_reviews.review: Fast, easy and an enjoyable ride up and down the strip. Taking the monorail save us countless steps and brought us to all the venues we wanted to visit. We purchased the four day pass which was complete adequate for our visit to Las Vegas. I would highly recommend the monorail for anyone who is staying on the strip.

top_reviews.title: Good alternative to The Deuce and taxis
top_reviews.review: Good alternative to The Deuce bus that runs along the Strip, Ideal if your hotel is close to the monorail (Sahara, Westgate etc). Cheaper to buy online tickets than paper tickets at the station. However, signage is poor (probably because it offers a good alternative to taxis so there's pressure from the taxi companies not to promote monorail). I would suggest that you ride the monorail FROM your hotel to your destination so that when you want to return to your hotel, you know exactly how to get to the station for your return ride.

top_reviews.title: Fast and convenient way to travel the strip
top_reviews.review: The monorail is a convenient way to get around the strip without having to walk/drive. There are seven stops, bookended by the MGM and the Sahara. If you are getting off at the MGM and trying to get to the strip, follow the signs for âNew York New Yorkâ. It isnât well marked how to get out to the strip from the monorail drop off point but if you follow the signs to NYNY you can get there in 10-15 mins (depending on how fast you walk). The inside of the monorail is a bit dated - but it serves its purpose.

top_reviews.title: Travel made easy
top_reviews.review: This was cheap and easy to travel locally. I bought a day pass a stop was located right out front of our hotel. I got off on any stop I wanted and quickly. If you buy your pass on your phone it's a couple cents cheaper.

name: The Cosmopolitan Casino
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4309
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 5 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 10 min walk

top_reviews.title: Good drinks while gambling
top_reviews.review: Great midday drink service if you want to gamble (get free drinks) during nap time. $5 first tip and $3 each drinks get you a server every 15-20 minutes If you know nothing about gambling, a slot machine will say min xx credits or $XX. That is the minimum bet on the machine, even if it is a penny slot. Some machines allow you to switch games, often the game that is not the default one has lower limits. Then there are the number of lines you are playing, this is how you win. Some machines allow you to change this. Some of the older machines we have a low amount you can win, like $10 on a $0.01 line without a jackpot. These machines are more fun since they do a lot more small payouts and arenât saving money for the big one. Find one of these machines that costs less than $0.25 minimum (play at least 9 lines, preferably just 9 lines since going up doesnât dramatically increase your payout number of spins on 3 rows, it does increase your winnings when wilds hit, but I prefer frequent small wins for low cost),and after an hour you will have had 3-4 decent cocktails and likely within $5 of what you started with. I played mid casino acrossish from the red neon lips in a shop. Best part is the machines I liked were in a row so you can socialize. This doesnât get you rich, but gets you drinks and is fun. Then you can always go and play the table games.

top_reviews.title: Use Marriott points for luxurious Cosmo
top_reviews.review: Use Marriott points for luxurious Cosmo Experience luxury at its finest at The Cosmopolitan Las Vegas! â¨ From chic rooms to world-class dining, vibrant nightlife, and endless entertainment, your Las Vegas getaway starts here. They have amazing nightclub, Marquee. Superb three level Chandelier bar, and many other restaurants to eat! Rooms are very luxurious, great view of Bellagio fountains, from room or while dining. Overall it's a great luxury ð° !

top_reviews.title: Slots and drinks
top_reviews.review: The casino is beautiful. Huge variety of slots, not sure how many, but a huge selection of big video slots. I liked lobster Louis. The chandelier bar is beautiful. Best cosmopolitan I have ever had. I havenât stayed there but want to . Highly recommend for drinks and playing slots

top_reviews.title: Lavish Casino Providing Vegas Glitz
top_reviews.review: Lavish casino with lively atmosphere inside. The three-story Chandelier Lounge is a signature feature of the casino. Provides the glitz and glamour that Vegas is known for. Very busy even in the early afternoon. This hotel has been an excellent addition to the Las Vegas Strip, and it has been considered the top hotel in the city and was even once named the best hotel in North America.

top_reviews.title: Balconies are amazing
top_reviews.review: Worth it for a balcony room as we were too tired to go out on an evening. Such a shame though that everyone seems to smoke weed on their balconies which stinks. Meant we had to go in when our neighbours were out and keep the door shut to avoid our room stinking of it. Itâs prohibited but itâs not policed anywhere. Grim and for the price we paid it was disappointing. Casino is always very very busy.

top_reviews.title: The Cosmopolitan on the Strip
top_reviews.review: We were in Vegas this past weekend and visited The Cosmopolitan. What an absolutely beautiful hotel! The appointment of all the details in design were aesthetically pleasing and luxurious. I loved all of the draping crystals! The staff that we interacted with were all very kind and respectful; however, one gentleman stood out in particular--Melvin. We met Melvin when we needed assistance and he was incredibly helpful! Some of our group were a little inebriated, but that didn't phase Melvin at all--he was always very gracious and professional. He had the patience and kindness of a saint! Melvin really added to the enjoyment of our evening and we really appreciated him going the extra mile for us!

name: The Neon Museum
description: Displaying over 250 retired signs of casinos and businesses from all over town, The Neon Museum offers a peek into old Vegas. On a tour through the museum's two-acre courtyard, youâll see gigantic, glitzy signs and learn more about their history. You can also watch the Brilliant! Jackpot show, a fantastic augmented reality experience that reanimates 40 of the neon signs in the museum. Donât forget to stop by the gift shop for souvenirs, as well as the visitor's center which is located inside the former La Concha Hotel lobby. Though open from mid-afternoon, The Neon Museum looks even more spectacular after sunset when the signs are lit up.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 770 Las Vegas Blvd N, Las Vegas, NV 89101-2010

top_reviews.title: After visiting so many times we finally made it. It was very nostalgic and fun. We did both tours at night and enjoyed.
top_reviews.review: Finally made it to the neon museum and loved it did both tours at night. This is something Iâve wanted to do for 29 years. Itâs interesting history and cool to see the signs up close. The new artist did an amazing job with the new exhibit, very cool to see old signs that no longer work lite up. The music and the video was cool too. The old hotel the gift shop and office are in are very neat too see and even the courtyard next too it where you wait for the 2nd tour, which Iâm assuming at one time held the pool. Our tour guide Trinity was amazing, and the other guide was nice too I canât remember her name though.

top_reviews.title: Perfect evening in the boneyard!
top_reviews.review: Leah was our guide - she was really engaging, knowledgeable and kept it fun! When we first saw that it was a tour - I was more hesitant. I had just wanted to go in and check out the cool signs at night. We'd have missed SO MUCH if we would have just read signs along the way. We learned so much, have a greater appreciation of the history of Vegas through signage and the legacy these beauties leave behind.

top_reviews.title: Truly captivating experience
top_reviews.review: My visit to the Neon Museum in Las Vegas in October 2023 was a truly captivating experience. This outdoor museum is a remarkable tribute to the city's vibrant history and a must-see attraction. The collection of vintage neon signs in the museum offers a journey into the heart of old Las Vegas. Every sign carries a piece of the city's legacy, representing former hotels, businesses, and iconic spots that once adorned the streets. I joined one of the guided tours, and I was amazed by the wealth of knowledge and passion our guide brought to the experience. The stories behind the signs came to life, making the tour all the more engaging. For photography enthusiasts, the Neon Museum is a paradise. The signs, especially when they come to life in the evening, present endless opportunities for striking photographs. Whether you're a professional or just a casual photographer, you'll find inspiration in every corner. Be mindful that the museum is an outdoor venue, so prepare accordingly for the weather. Las Vegas can get quite hot during the day, so dress comfortably and stay hydrated. To avoid disappointment, I highly recommend reserving your tickets in advance, as this attraction tends to draw a crowd. If you have the chance, visit in the evening when the signs are illuminated. The colors and ambiance during this time are truly enchanting, making it an ideal choice. Before you leave, don't forget to explore the museum's gift shop. It's stocked with a variety of neon sign-themed souvenirs, offering you the perfect way to remember your visit.

top_reviews.title: Awesome Tour!
top_reviews.review: My friends and I loved this tour! Do the night version for sure, when the signs are all lit up at night itâs so cool. Learning the fun history of the signs and Vegas with our excellent tour guide made for a fun night. Our Lyft driver told us this wasnât a very good neighborhood so maybe donât walk here but we felt safe while on property the entire time. Also, great gift shop!

top_reviews.title: An essential place to visit in Las Vegas!
top_reviews.review: Visiting the Neon Museum will decode Las Vegas for you. It is a beautiful and immaculately clean outdoor museum with passionate docents who personalize the tour which makes it truly top notch, so much more than a memorized speech or a robotic headphone tour you might get at a museum that cares less about excellence. The optional âBrilliantâ show is so magical and there are several versions to see so you can return again and see another one! Youâll want to spend 1-2 hours there. Be prepared because there is not much shelter from the elements. Las Vegas is blistering hot in the summer. I drank several drinks and the seating outdoors was uncomfortably hot. During a winter visit, there was one small heater for two groups of tourists waiting outside for up to 30 minutes. Prepare accordingly, it is 100% worth at least one visit!

top_reviews.title: Get this on your bucket list !
top_reviews.review: So glad I was talked into this. Iâll happily admit it wasnât on my list of places to visit in Vegas, but, how glad am I that I went. Brilliant ! We took the last organised tour of the evening and enjoyed every single minute of this trip back in time. Iâm sure a trip in the daylight letâs you see things differently but our night tour was spectacular. Get this on your must visit list the next time youâre in Vegas, you will not regret it at all.

top_reviews.title: Fun and so much history!
top_reviews.review: Highly recommend doing the guided tour! Thereâs a story behind each sign. So much incredible history here. And of course, the signs are beautiful, especially at night! Definitely worth the visit. We did walk from Fremont which wasnât bad. However, as others have said, not much lighting along the way.

top_reviews.title: Enlightening!
top_reviews.review: The Neon Museum was so much fun! We really enjoyed the guided tour with Steve. He was so knowledgeable and had some great personal experiences to add to the tour. Itâs so neat to see the old signs and itâs a great cause that they devote their proceeds to further the preservation of these amazing works of art! It was especially special for me to see Stardust again as itâs the first sign I remember from my first visit to Las Vegas in the 90s. Thank you very much!

top_reviews.title: Worth it once
top_reviews.review: This was on our list of things to do while visiting for the weekend. We did the night tour and it seems like a good time to go to see them all lit up. Kat provided us with a lot of history, but note there is not a lot of time to stop for photos during a tour. The tour is a one and done thing for me personally. We were told by a few people sunset is the time to go, so maybe next time and we will do self-guided tour around dusk. Definitely in a scary part of town like others say, so I do agree with taking an uber/taxi. It's gated in for tourists.

top_reviews.title: Fun Nighttime Tour
top_reviews.review: We had a great evening at the Neon Museum, especially the guided tour. A fun way to learn more about Vegas history and it was fun to see the old signs lit up. Definitely worth the drive: highly recommend!

name: Las Vegas Natural History Museum
description: The Las Vegas Natural History Museum was established in 1989. After humble beginnings, this private nonprofit museum is now a Smithsonian Affiliate, accredited with the American Alliance of Museums, and is a federal and state repository for fossils and artifacts. From the desert to the ocean, from Nevada to Africa, from prehistoric times to the present, the Las Vegas Natural History Museum takes visitors of all ages on a learning adventure around the world.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 900 Las Vegas Blvd. N, Las Vegas, NV 89101-1112

name: Silverton Aquarium
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3333 Blue Diamond Rd Silverton Casino Lodge, Las Vegas, NV 89139-7873

name: The Liberace Museum Collection
description: Liberace is a fascinating Las Vegas Strip origin story, involving many celebrities and personalities of note. This is the only tour of the legendary collections of influential showman Liberace, at the former residence of Michael Jackson in Las Vegas. Request an invitation to be one of the few to see the costumes, pianos, historic photos and documents, fine art and treasures, narrated by the Chairman of the Foundation himself. It's not open to the general public. See why Carlos Santana, Tyga and YG recorded "Mamacita" here in 2018. Find out how Liberace costumes became the topic of the 2019 MET Gala; hear why Cardi B borrowed the Liberace piano for her performance on the 2019 Grammys. Experience the route through this mansion, taken by Broadway and West End star Michael Ball , see why the recorded amid the Liberace collection. Learn why Boy George took this tour and recorded the song "How To Be a Chandelier" about Liberace, in 2023.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 5115 Dean Martin Dr Unit 905, Las Vegas, NV 89118-1712

name: Stratosphere Tower
description: The Tower is a unique, iconic fixture in the Vegas skyline with a magnificent 360 degree view of the shimmering Las Vegas Strip and Valley.
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Observation Decks & Towers
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 2000 Las Vegas Blvd S Stratosphere Casino Hotel & Tower, Las Vegas, NV 89104-2507
getting_there: SLS Station â¢ 7 min walk

top_reviews.title: Must see in Vegas
top_reviews.review: Went up to the viewing platform on a lovely sunny day for the brilliant views. Did not attempt any of the rides. Nice fast lifts. There are indoor and outdoor areas. A nice bar indoors where you can sit and watch the daredevils leaping off the tower. Well worth a visit

top_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing views day and of course night. An absolute must do!
top_reviews.review: Jaw dropping views of the whole of Vegas. Looks amazing day and of course night. The view of the strip with many landmarks easily visible is a sight to behold. Overwhelming. Hundreds of pictures and videos to record. Above is scary rides involving being dropped in a lift or a short rollercoaster that appears to go off the edge and stops just in time. Too much for me. Couldnât contemplate the extreme drops off the top that you can do from here too. Note it can be cold at night so bring something to keep you warm. Great lower level inside with bar, cafe and shop with comfortable seats and the same views behind glass. Elevators work well and there are a few to get you up and down plus stairs for the last few levels. Easy to get to once in Strat Hotel. After a security check then it is up to the top. A must do in Vegas!

top_reviews.title: Cool 360 degree view of Vegas and the area
top_reviews.review: Really neat view of Vegas from one of the tallest buildings west of the Mississippi. There are plenty of windows to look through, and touchscreens around the room identify landmarks you see. You can go outside and walk most of the way around and use the pay-binoculars on posts if you want (take quarters). Take all the time you want. If you decide to arrive by monorail, you will have to walk for 10 minutes or so in a rougher part of town.

top_reviews.title: Great views
top_reviews.review: The views really are amazing and I liked that there were areas to sit and enjoy a drink and a snack if you werenât dining in the restaurant. The staff were all very nice here too and the lift attendant very conscientious. Well worth a visit

top_reviews.title: Best view over Las Vegas
top_reviews.review: We went to the observation desk to see the sunset and it was absolutely beautiful. You can see the boulevard and many sites from a different perspective. Even the surrounding desert and rock formation can be seen. We didn't go for the rollercoaster but it's surely exciting. Worth a visit!

top_reviews.title: Having the time of my life ððï¸ðï¸ðð¯
top_reviews.review: Ok certain Vegas hotel have " their must do item" The Strat has its 360 tower views, after dark is great, I recently went on 2out of 3 outside rides ( one was down for routine inspection ðï¸ðï¸ð, My personal fav was Big-Shot. The sky jump is a separate ticket. You can purchase a all day/evening pass for the outside rides and enjoy them till 10pm

top_reviews.title: Vegas Trip
top_reviews.review: Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are better rooms for better prices up and down the strip. The view from the tower at night was amazing but you have to pay to go up there even though you are staying at the hotel. They charged resort fees even though nothing was different than any other hotel.

top_reviews.title: Fantastic views and ice cream.
top_reviews.review: The view from up there is amazing. We went outside to look around but liked it better inside. We sat around looking at the views for ages and had ice cream while we were up there. Nice little gift shop up there and you could get a cocktail up there if you wanted. Really pleased we went up there. Highly recommended.

top_reviews.title: Stunning views
top_reviews.review: A great view from the top. We went in the evening, just as the sun was going down. No queues, plenty of space at the top. Great views across the city, and great that you can go outside as well (and watch all the mad people who are doing the rides/jumps). You can park on the road not far from the strat for free.

top_reviews.title: Most amazing wedding reception.
top_reviews.review: Firstly, we didnât stay at this hotel, we stayed at the mgm grand, however I really wish we had stayed at the stratosphere, as all the staff was so friendly. We did though, have my daughters wedding reception there in the twilight room which is right at the top of the strat. It was amazing! The room was beautifully set up, the food was fantastic, the views phenomenal, but what really made it was the staff. The wait staff were so professional, polite and friendly, but the barman, and Iâm ashamed to have not got his name was excellent so friendly, and he certainly knew how to poor a drink! He was fast and efficient and there was no queuing for drinks. The manager saw everything ran so smoothly. It was such a fantastic day. Thank you so much stratos. The wedding was 24th April at 6pm young/forsyth wedding, I hope you can tell the barman how brilliant we thought he was.

name: O - Cirque du Soleil
description: Be whisked away by Cirque Du Soleilâs 'O', an aquatic and acrobatic extravaganza at the Bellagio in Las Vegas. This surreal and theatrical show features acrobats, synchronized swimmers and divers performing emotive and death-defying acts in the water and on floating rafts, suspended steel ships, and 60-foot platforms. The first few rows are the designated splash zone, so you might want to bring a waterproof jacket if you want to stay dry. Get a regular ticket, or treat yourself to the V.I.P. Experience, which includes suite seats, an exclusive meet and greet, champagne, and a guided tour. â Tripadvisor
category: Cirque du Soleil Shows Theater & Performances
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S Bellagio Hotel, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4303
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 7 min walk
Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 10 min walk

name: Absinthe
description: Refreshing and irrepressibly raunchy, ABSINTHE is an intoxicating cocktail of jaw-dropping adult circus, burlesque and vaudeville, remixed and reimagined to tease, please and delight even cynical, seen-it-all audiences. So mark your calendars, mask up and wash your freakin' hands, because January 16th, the "#1 greatest show in Las Vegas history" (Las Vegas Weekly) returns to stage, as staggeringly sexy, death-defyingly thrilling and off-the-wall hilarious as you rememberâand a zillion times safer than youâd expect. Unapologetically outrageous and undeniably absurd, Absinthe is for ages 18 and above.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3570 Las Vegas Blvd S Caesars Palace, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8924
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 6 min walk
Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 6 min walk

top_reviews.title: Best Show on the Strip!
top_reviews.review: Do this NOW!! One of the best shows around. Incredibly talented performers. Very fast moving non-stop entertainment. This is an adult show. If you are easily offended, do not go. We sat up front and were in the insult "splash zone". We laughed for the entire time. A MUST do on the strip. Wanda and The Gazillionaire were hilarious - they made the show.

top_reviews.title: Be sure you have plenty to drink ahead of time
top_reviews.review: Well, I can't stress enough that if you are easily offended, this is NOT the show for you. Quite crude in parts--but funny as well and the acrobats are simply amazing. It's the kind of show that you will ONLY find in LV!

top_reviews.title: Rude, crude and utterly hilarious...
top_reviews.review: Utterly amazing and hilarious show. If you're easily offended or even not so easily offended, then beware! Leave your prudishness at the door as there'll be bad language, disgusting (but hilarious) jokes and maybe even full monologues about intimate acts! The acrobats, dancers, strongmen and contortionists were utterly fantastic and very engaging! Pretty much a circus of amazing people for mature (or extremely immature) adults only! The seating is quirky. Mismatched cushioned and hard metal seats in a circle around the stage and it's a bit squished but it lends itself to the quirky circus vibe. Just be ready to touch the person next to you if you're a bit bigger! However, there's not bad place to sit and you should be able to see from anywhere. "The Gazillionaire" MC was fun and brutal on people in the first three rows so if you can't take a joke or don't like attention, sit further back! All in all, a fantastic night out and one of the better shows we seen in Vegas.

top_reviews.title: Entertaining and fun....don't order the Love Potion
top_reviews.review: Fun show!! Funny and entertaining, talented performers...it was really good! Only giving 4 stars because of a couple things. The seating kinda sucks. You sit like sardines on hard chairs the whole time and it's so loud that you can't hear when the server comes along to see if you want a drink. I had no time to look over the drink menu, couldn't see it anyway cause it was so dark, so I quickly ordered the first thing I seen for my 6 friends so we could all enjoy a drink while watching the show. Bad move haha! I ordered 6 Love Potions without seeing what was in it or knowing how much it would cost, well that's the first time I've ever spend $275.00 (CAD) on 6 drinks LOL. I wouldn't have even minded so much if they were good. Yuck. Tasted gross. Most of us couldn't even drink them. So just don't order drinks, enjoy the show and you'll have a great time!

top_reviews.title: A fun night out
top_reviews.review: First a warning: If you are offended by f-bombs and risque situations, you probably shouldn't go. There's a lot of both. But if you don't mind either, then Absinthe is great entertainment. The commentary by the Gazillionaire was really funny and the acrobatics were amazing. The staff was also outstanding. The major drawback is the seating. They use trendy metal chairs, some raised, some normal but all somewhat uncomfortable.

top_reviews.title: Everything I love about Vegas in 1 show
top_reviews.review: This show is everything I love about Vegas wrapped up in one hilarious, raunchy, fun, jaw-dropping variety show. I read reviews first, and I'm surprised that it had any negative ones. This is definitely a rated R show, but I didn't find it particularly offensive at all. The acts were marvelous and had us on the edge of our seats. In fact, in response to those who wrote about uncomfortable seating, it didn't matter how my seat felt because we wanted to hoot and holler and stand and cheer most of the show. Bravo to the performers. Perfect date night and thanks for an unforgettable show.

top_reviews.title: Raunchy but funny
top_reviews.review: If you are easily offended, consider another show. If you are traveling with your young (adult) children, consider another show. If you want a combination of strip joint, circus acts and some comedyâthis will be the show for you. At times I just sat with my jaw openâ¦ sometimes amazed at the act, sometimes amazed at what one of the two hosts had said. Just Wow! Acrobats, jugglers and roller skaters were all amazing. You will be astonished. The view is good from pretty much any seat - but the seats are extremely closeâ¦. and hard. Donât pick close up if you donât want to be berated/verbally picked on. It was a great showâ¦but tickets were expensive.

top_reviews.title: A raunchy show in an intimate tent setting
top_reviews.review: I enjoyed this show a lot, and can understand why many reviewers recommend this as a top "must see" show. There wasn't any nudity, but the performances and jokes were definitely very raunchy. The acts were very good, with my least favorite being the tap dancing. If you're sitting in the inner circle, you are definitely in the splash zone; literally splashes from an act with water, but also figuratively as in the emcee is likely to pick on you as part of the crowd work. The venue is small and intimate, you will definitely be able to see the acts from anywhere you sit. I do recommend sitting in the sections to the left or the right of the entrance (I think that gives a better view of the performers). The chairs are just assorted, but from what I could tell the ones closer to the middle are pushed more tightly together and look uncushioned. We had heavy coats to deal with the very cold outside temperature, but we were able to take them off inside the tent where it was very comfortable.

top_reviews.title: A fun show, lots of laughs.
top_reviews.review: The show was very entertaining, definitely crude humour so if you're easily offended, do not go. The performers were very talented. There was a lot of filler during the show, with the host and his sidekick bridging the setup for the next performer. We enjoyed the show but felt it was overpriced for what you got, especially when you compare it to the quality and cost of a Cirque show.

top_reviews.title: Go see it. Amazing
top_reviews.review: Great adult fun. Amazing show with a hilarious MC. It's crass, raunchy, filthy and fantastic. Go watch it and take a good sense of humor if you're in the front row or two.

name: T-Mobile Arena
description: Las Vegasâ hottest new sports and entertainment venue, located just west of the famed Las Vegas Strip, will be officially named T-Mobile Arena. T-Mobile Arena will be the destination in Las Vegas for live events â from amazing music acts to thrilling sporting events â it will set a new standard for what entertainment means in the city that does it best. Legal: Legal@T-MobileArena.email Absorption Info: Info@T-MobileArena.email â¥Â® T-Mobile Arena by L-WIRE INTERNATIONAL
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3780 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-9309

top_reviews.title: Easy to get around, nice arena!
top_reviews.review: I like the arena. It's small enough to get around easy. They do allow smoking on balconies once you have gotten inside. Read your tickets. When they say "no bags", that also means purses. Purses won't stated on the ticket, I assumed backpacks, gym-type bags, etc. They meant ALL bags bigger than a 8"x3" approx. They do offer lockers, but don't tell you until you have stood in line and ready to go through metal detectors. Be aware. On good note, ebay did offer large clear bags to put your purse contents into. But...it is very expensive to purchase any beverage, somehwat more expense than other places on the Strip. Credit card only, no cash. Seating is generally good anywhere in the arena, depending on the venue. You don't feel swarmed when entering/exiting the arena, like you do at the Sphere. Lot more casual. They provided entertainment outside the arena until the doors opened.

top_reviews.title: Fantastic
top_reviews.review: Amazing venue. My husband went to a hockey game and was blown away by the stadium and everything about the experience. He couldn't stop talking about it. He's ready to go back for more. :-)

top_reviews.title: GO KNIGHTS GO
top_reviews.review: I have seen quite a few hockey games at quite a few arenas. This one is hands down the best arena in North America to watch an NHL game and itâs not contest imo. You canât beat that vibe and pre show. The interior design is outstanding, and I LOVE that thereâs a designated smokers area as the majority of arenas donât have that. Itâs one of the loudest and most energetic buildings Iâve been in and whoever said hockey wouldnât work in Vegas was clearly wrong. Definitely recommend catching a game during your visit even if youâre not a sports fan, you will have a great time!

top_reviews.title: Awesome arena and show
top_reviews.review: What a fantastic arena. Lots of excitement and action going on. Outside has many bar options for pregame. Inside has plenty of food and drink options. Great site lines and definitely a showâ¦ before the game even started.

top_reviews.title: Fun at T-Mobile Stadium
top_reviews.review: We went for a hockey game we were amazed. The Vegas Golden Knights played really well but everything else was great to. The VGK theme is medieval Knights and they are all in. It was a show within a show. Before you get in the stadium they have a huge knight mask outside to take pictures with. Once you are inside its welcome to the fortress. They have a huge fortress in the upper stands with a DJ, ice girls and the best seats in the house which they upgrade someone. When a player enters the penalty box everyone chants shame, shame, shame. The players entry onto the ice is a spectacle and so is when the home team scores a goal. The home crowd is all in and it was a very fun hockey game. There was a large food and beverage selection.

top_reviews.title: Great for concert
top_reviews.review: First time there for a concert. The queue was fast for the VIP entry. Our suite came with buffet on the same floor. They had good selection for the food and desert at the buffet. The display for the desert and beverage was really nice!!

top_reviews.title: Perfect venue to see Madonna
top_reviews.review: We queued for a while but once the doors were open it was a quick and easy process getting through security and into the arena. Once inside there were plenty of friendly and helpful staff to guide us to our seats. Even though our seats were relatively cheap the view of the concert was brilliant and Madonna wasn't just a little dot in the distance. The sound and atmosphere was awesome as were the video screens. Excellent concert and brilliant venue!

top_reviews.title: Nice arena
top_reviews.review: We just seen the Knights play Tampa Bay and it was a pretty good game. The arena is excellent and I don't think there is a bad seat anywhere. The vibe is great as the fans really get into it. They absolutely do not take cash, only cards, so if you are like me(Canadian) and don't call your credit card company and tell them you are going to be visiting Las Vegas you won't get food or drinks. I used my card once to get raffle tickets and I guess it got flagged and I couldn't use it again. But still we had a great time.

top_reviews.title: Golden Knights Experience
top_reviews.review: Went for the Golden Knights game versus Seattle Kraken. The game was entertaining and the pace of play was back and forth. It was a tight game score wise as Vegas scored in the last two minutes to win the game. Entering the building is fine as it standard security for major sporting events. The prices for food and drinks inside the building are very expensive. Make sure you grab a drink and a bite to eat before hand. This game was unique as they have different in game activities which is different from other NHL games I've attended.

top_reviews.title: loud building and great entertainment!
top_reviews.review: came from vancouver Island to see the canucks play the knights and man, this place was rockin! cool atmosphere outside before the game,the pre game hype video is pretty cool including a sword fight on the ice. lots of entertainment all game and intermissions, this building gets seriously loud!

name: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area
description: Visitors can admire colorful rock formations on several hiking trails or on a 13-mile scenic drive.
category: State Parks National Parks Nature & Wildlife Areas Canyons Geologic Formations
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area
address: 1000 Scenic Loop Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89161

top_reviews.title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome
top_reviews.review: We love going to Red Rocks. The scenery is indescribable, and the park wasn't too crowded so it worked out perfectly. We did some of the smaller trails and even gave Turtlehead a shot (didn't make it the whole way). It is a must do if going out to Vegas, just make sure you book a reservation starting in October.

top_reviews.title: Amazing view
top_reviews.review: If you are in Vegas, this is a must!! The view is no less than amazing. The pictures are not misleading. You can take a hike or just travel with the car and stop for pictures. I recommend both. The entrance cost is 22USD, worth every penny. From October 1st you need to register in advance!

top_reviews.title: Fantastic day! Return trip needed.
top_reviews.review: Stunning area. Joined a Pink Jeep tour as my family all flew out a day before me. I had had a fantastic day. Would love to go back.again. many great hikes to do and loved exploring the different landscapes.

top_reviews.title: Get out of Las Vegas get to Red Rock Canyon!
top_reviews.review: Red Rock Canyon, just outside Las Vegas, offers a striking escape from the city's glamour. The iconic red sandstone formations and diverse hiking trails provide a serene desert adventure. It's conveniently located for both tourists and locals and offers a peaceful retreat in the American Southwest's rugged beauty, making it a perfect day trip destination to experience the stunning natural landscapes away from the Las Vegas Strip.

top_reviews.title: Stunning Red Rock Canyon Views
top_reviews.review: Beautiful day trip to the Red Rock Canyon.. The view were amazing. Well worth the $22 I spent($20 for the entrance, $2 for the reservation fee) I booked it early online to skip the line at the entrance, veer to the right if you have a prepaid reservation. Would do again next time I have a car in Vegas

top_reviews.title: Worth It, But Book In Advance or Be Turned Away
top_reviews.review: So, this review is based on past visits. Pre-Covid, you could just drive through. In November 2022, they required that you make a reservation for a timed entry, but they let us through anyway. In November 2023, they still require a reservation but now they turn you away if you don't have one. The problem with this is that we had no cell service at the entrance, and by the time we got service back, we had decided to do something else. With that said, the loop is absolutely gorgeous with stunning views from several different locations. Definitely a must-see, just book in advance.

top_reviews.title: lovely nature area just half an hour from the LV strip
top_reviews.review: This place is gorgeous. My friends and I did the 13 mile route drive and made a bunch of the stops. We hiked some, but not any of the very long/strenuous ones. It is sunny with little shade but when I visited there were a lot of shrubs and cacti. People were rock climbing and rapelling. There was even an area with some old rock paintings which was pretty cool. It is about 30 minutes from the strip and so worth the drive. We did need to make an online timed reservation and pay a small fee to enter, but it was totally worth it.

top_reviews.title: Scenery is amazing. Air is clean. Seems like zero pollution.
top_reviews.review: They have a really nice trail. About 3.5 miles. Not too difficult but it gets rocky. Scenery is beautiful. Make sure to take lots of pics. Donât forget to bring water and a snack. There are no convenience storeâs anywhere near. Parking lot is small and gets full quick but thereâs street parking. Have fun.

top_reviews.title: Picturesque desert near Las Vegas
top_reviews.review: Good half-day trip away from the crowds on the Strip. We went with Pink Jeep Tours, which I recommend. If you have a rental car, it looks like a good place to hike independent from a tour.

top_reviews.title: vacation
top_reviews.review: we went here to see the sights. we spent several hours driving thru and did a couple of small hikes. has bathrooms at the stops. easy to find. does cost to see. you drive thru at your own pace. vistors center good place to start. its a total of 13 mile loop. you do need to schedule a time to go thru

name: Palazzo Resort Casino
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3325 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-1414
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 9 min walk

name: Ellis Island Casino & Brewery
description: A true landmark for almost 50 years, the family-owned Ellis Island Hotel, Casino & Brewery is an affordable, comfortable blend of casino thrills, family-friendly atmosphere and superb dining with a whole lot of warmth and hospitality. Step through our doors and find yourself face-to-face with an abundance of ways to play. Enjoy our casino with nearly 300 of the hottest slots, live blackjack, roulette, craps and our sports book. Enjoy Las Vegas' #1 Karaoke venue or our very own Ellis Island Brewery, which became the number one brewery in all of Nevada by serving over a million frosty glasses of happiness a year. Eat at our world famous Village Pub Cafe and for a quick bite try Julio's Tacos or Metro Pizza. And yet, despite all of our unique amenities, it is our friendly and personalized service that ranks Ellis Island Hotel, Casino & Brewery among the best in Las Vegas.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 4178 Koval Ln, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4568
getting_there: Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 8 min walk
Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 9 min walk

top_reviews.title: Nice alternative to the Strip
top_reviews.review: It's good to have a place to find cheaper food and drinks with smaller minimum bets than Strip casinos. The Front Porch beer garden was a nice outdoor space to enjoy a beer, but strangely did not serve pizza. So we had to wait until one of the four tables by the indoor pizza stand opened up and brought our beer over there. Then we went back to the beer garden to play blackjack at a table out there. So the beer was very good, the pizza was fine, but the flow did not make sense to us.

top_reviews.title: Great visits to Ellis Island.
top_reviews.review: This review is for the for Village pub and cafe as well as for the casino. We arrived late into Vegas our first night We ate at the Village Pub. The late nite menu is smaller than their regular menu. Food was good and service was friendly. Gambled here a few days during our vacation. Had a great time playing Blackjack and Craps. Dealers are friendly and fun. Shout out to Mike on The craps table. Ate off their full menu our last night in Vegas. Once again door was good and affordable. Service was great. Try Ellis Island for good and gambling. You wonât be disappointed.

top_reviews.title: Good place to visit
top_reviews.review: The casino is small but they have $5 blackjack tables and the dealers are a lot of fun. The food in the restaurant is excellent and the beer garden is amazing. Lots of TVs and good craft beer (for only $4 a pint). The servers were all wonderful, especially Brigitte. However, we did have a bad experience with a staff member named Quinn. Not sure if he is a server or bartender or what but he was in the beer garden and he was very rude and disrespectful. It tainted our visit to the casino and restaurant a little which is disappointing.

top_reviews.title: Ellis Island Karaoke
top_reviews.review: Go on a Tuesday night they told me. It'll be slow they said. OMG they were wonderfully wrong! So many good singers. I mean professional quality singers. All genres, from rock to blues to country to R&B, each singer was better than the last. Leaning more towards locals, they cheered on each new singer like they were at a private show.

top_reviews.title: Fun Casino That Tries to Provide an Enjoyable Experience with Good Value
top_reviews.review: Located just off The Strip, this is a very different experience than visiting most casinos in Vegas especially those on The Strip. It is a more down to earth experience. Smaller and nothing stylish about it but it is clean and still a really fun atmosphere inside. You won't find any $5 minimum blackjack tables on The Strip. The Front Yard offers very good quality food at reasonable prices with indoor and outdoor dining and a nice beer selection. There are a lot of cheap and sketchy places to gamble in town, but I get the sense that the owners are all about providing an enjoyable experience with good value. If I'm going to lose my money to a casino in Vegas, I would rather do it in a place like this that at least tries to offer you something in return for your business.

top_reviews.title: Ellis Island change
top_reviews.review: Since finding this hole in the wall casino, we have made this our go to for breakfast every morning when we are in Las Vegas. First, we would walk from Bally's then we started Ubering from where we were staying. This time we had rented a vehicle and had my family with kids here. The breakfast is always our favorite. The breakfast special has been the go-to selection. It started out in 2012 at $5.99. Steak, egg, potatoes, and toast. Along with coffee, made for a big breakfast deal. It was $12.99 this trip. I guess inflation has hit. The Casino has become a really nice attraction as the facade has expanded and several inside games and slots have made a big move up. They are still expanding I'd say due to the Grand Prix experience last year. I feel this is afforded a transformation to this place. I'm happy for them but am amiss as to my experience with all that is taking place. We like this place due to its old Vegas appeal it had. Table games are now infringing on the slots room, along with the Front Yard bar and grill. This past trip has left me with the feeling that we are losing our Las Vegas experience with Ellis Island. Prices on everything in Vegas has grown to curtail our experiences there. As far as going back, we may go less often and maybe experience this gem less often.

top_reviews.title: Off Strip but spotless and a few freebies missing from corporate hotels
top_reviews.review: This three story motel looking structure is off the strip. I'm 64 and had a difficult time walking. It makes up for the mediocre location with a clean room. A refrigerator. A coffee maker. Two free waters A complementary coffee and croissant. I didn't like standing in line and waiting till exactly 3pm to check in. Many hotels are doing this without exceptions. Big mistake!!!!!!!!!! This place is for couples. Not a family. A solo young traveler on a budget would love this place. It's not a resort. Far from it. I still categorized the place as very good. Would I stay here again. Probably not. It was a bit unnerving counting down the last seconds to check in at 3pm. Makes you feel unimportant and kind of depressing especially for older people. And what's up with a Resort Fee when it's not that.

top_reviews.title: The BBQ meal is spiraling downward FAST!
top_reviews.review: We have been coming here for 14 incredible years for the BBQ ribs. They were the best we ever had anywhere. So delicious, fall off the bone, a masterpiece. Our last trip they were a combination of slightly hard and rubbery. We were both sooooo sad and disappointed. Please go back to making ribs slowly with pride to enhance the quality, or you will lose us and many many more with your cutting corners new recipe.

top_reviews.title: Ellis Island Casino - Las Vegas
top_reviews.review: Nice gambling just off the strip. Highlight is very friendly and courteous staff. Price is reasonable, especially for off strip. Karaoke and food options available at visit, standard gambling games present. Short walk off strip but be mindful of neighborhood when doing so.

top_reviews.title: Not like it was " Oh Well"
top_reviews.review: Too Sad the coffee shop long known for their quality and value has also lost touch with that too. Used to love going here for a casual dining meal and felt like you go your moneys worth. Not this last time. My wife ordered the steak special and the meat was unbearable. She sent it back as it was way to tough too even cut it up. So they brought her the calamari and that was also a fav of hers and that too went down hill . My BLT let's just say I had better a lot better at other place. So with that said will we go back? No I don't think so.

name: Titanic: The Artifact Exhibition
description: 350 recovered relics and full-scale recreations of the ill-fated Titanic luxury liner can be seen at this exhibition at the Luxor Hotel.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3900 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89119

top_reviews.title: Titanic exibit at Luxor is worth your time
top_reviews.review: Really enjoyed learning more about the Titanic, just when you think you know it all from the movie and all the documentaries, still learned lots more at an intimate level regarding the crew and passengers. Very immersive in hearing about their backgrounds, travel plans, the whyâs behind them, and how they âcruise shippedâ back in the day. A big takeaway that is still present today is how big corporations will push to the limits to achieve publicity even if it has the potential for catastrophic failure as was the case of pushing the Titanic almost to her limits in iceberg infested waters. Great re-creations and diaramas as well as a huge piece of the ship that was amazing to stand before and know it was not only the Titanic but had been resting on the ocean floor for a centuryâ¦just incredible. The artifacts are all interesting and is fascinating to see what lasted on the ocean floor to be on display before you, including money, playing cards, shoes, glasses, hair brushes, bottles, jewelry, and plate ware. Highly recommend!

top_reviews.title: Perfect for those with even a mild interest in the Titanic story. A must for history buffs.
top_reviews.review: My husband and I were excited about our visit to the Titanic Museum. Our Jaws dropped we learned these were authentic artifacts. We were pleased the atmosphere was one of reverence. We purchased the audio option, but felt it wasn't worth the extra money.

top_reviews.title: Great experience
top_reviews.review: This is an excellent exhibit. So many artifacts from the Titanic to look at. Great flow of information that really helped you understand the perspective of the people who were traveling on the Titanic. Mostly just looking at items / reading plaques, though there were some videos to watch and a couple of interactive ways to experience it (touching a fake iceberg, hearing the thrum of the engines, giving you a passenger's ticket). Be aware that you cannot take photos of the grand staircase part of the exhibit due to copyright. If you want a photo of that you have to buy one. This also gave us a reason to go into the Luxor, which is fun to see.

top_reviews.title: I'd consider this a must...
top_reviews.review: This was a top pick on our list. We really wanted to see this! When you go in, they give you a "boarding pass" for one of the passengers that was actually on the ship. It tells you a little about the person, in what class they traveled and a QR code. At the end, there is a place to scan the code to find out if you lived. This was informative and interesting. You need to understand that my son gets bored with museums pretty quick. He really enjoyed this. That is awesome! There were items from all the class accommodations with little signs telling you about the items - "this is a salt cellar from first class", for example. But there were also things there that absolutely blew my mind! There were items that were wrapped in paper that are still intact with the paper around it still. I find it amazing that the paper was still there! The "big piece" is just that....and then there is the diagram showing where it was on the boat....just WOW! I have seen a review somewhere comparing this to a thrift store. I don't know what that person expected to see from a sunken ship, but at no point did I get "thrift store". Most people were very respectful - there were a few older teens running which was distracting. Quotes from passengers posted all thru the exhibit - some made me cry. Information on how some people ended up on Titanic - that was interesting and new.

name: Mount Charleston
description: Experience the great outdoors at Mount Charleston, a quiet mountain retreat surrounded by tranquil, verdant landscapes just 30 minutes from Las Vegas. It is one of the largest peaks of the Spring Mountains National Recreation Area with plenty of activities available, like hiking, horseback riding, camping under the stars, climbing and biking. Visit during winter for skiing, snowing and sledding, or during the shoulder seasons for fall foliage or spring wildflowers. Just remember to check for last-minute closures to avoid disappointment. Whatever the season, don't miss all the best sights with a guided tour of Mount Charleston. â Tripadvisor
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas

top_reviews.title: Escape!
top_reviews.review: Great place to head to to escape the hustle and bustle...and heat...of Vegas and decompress. Beautiful drive transitioning from desert to cool mountain forest. There is a beautiful, quaint...and I'm sure very pricey mountain 'village'. Loved the cliff-side houses. A huge trail network ranging from quick to all day.

top_reviews.title: Not for the fainted hearted
top_reviews.review: The trail from the South Loop is difficult to be sure, but it can be done if you are in reasonable shape. Start early, bring lots of water. The first part is the switch backs to the junction to Griffith Peak. The second part winds through a meadow, burned area, and a steady climb to a ridge. The third part is the final steep ascend. Yes you get a 360 view, but the peak itself rather bare and uninspiring. You can get here from the North Loop, but it will be quite a bit longer, because you have to start from Deer Spring road instead of Trail Canyon. I have tried that several times, and always find myself running behind and have to turn back. But again, I go pretty slow.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful Mount Charleston!
top_reviews.review: Beautiful views and hiking trails for all levels of hikers! Little Falls Trail is a relatively easy hike and the waterfall at the end is gorgeous! Also, Mount Charleston is an easy drive from Vegas and it is significantly cooler up there especially in the morning. It does get crowded on the weekends, so go early if you can. Very nice Visitorâs Center too!

top_reviews.title: Fun and beauty with fresh air at Mt Charleston
top_reviews.review: This area is perfect for all ages. There are amazing views, and awesome places for a picnic or BBQ amongst the trees ðð The temperature is roughly 10 degrees cooler than down in the city of Vegas. It's a wonderful spot, not quite an hours drive out.

name: The LINQ Promenade
description: The LINQ Promenade is Caesars Entertainment's shopping, dining and entertainment district located at the center of the Las Vegas Strip which is home to 35+ restaurant and retail stores such as Brooklyn Bowl, Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips, IN-N-Out Burger, Razer, Yard House, and so much more! You can find exciting attractions at The LINQ Promenade such as The High Roller, North America's Tallest Observation wheel, and Fly LINQ Zipline, the strip's only zipline. There's something for everyone at The LINQ Promenade!
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3535 Las Vegas Blvd S Between The LINQ Hotel & Casino and Flamingo Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8921
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 3 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 6 min walk

top_reviews.title: Love the Linq
top_reviews.review: Awesome addition to Vegas and off the strip too. Many restaurants, bars, shops and experiences down one promenade. You have the hotel, casino, The Linq experience, Gordon Ramsey's fish and chips shop, Guy fieri's, Yard House and the best ice-cream shop ever. My favourite restaurant is actually Flour and Barley Brick Oven Pizza. Great place to people watch from too.

top_reviews.title: A cool place to walk and look around
top_reviews.review: It doesn't cost anything to walk the Promenade. You can stop for drinks/food along the way or shop at a variety of stores...or just people watch and enjoy the atmosphere. There are also multiple attractions such as the High Roller and other experiences that you can pay to participate in, but we didn't partake of any of those. We felt safe in this environment.

top_reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!
top_reviews.review: The price was perfect. My friend went with me to celebrate a recent celebration in my life. We did have to ask for a coffee pot which we thought was included, and was advised it was $10 a night, but the cost of the room was low so we didn't protest. The Linq was clean and centrally located to everything we wanted, which was great bc it was 107 degrees outside. I was especially delighted by the appearance of Spiderman outside with his companions, all costumed up in the heat, but willing to make a video for me! Gotta say, as an older woman, Spiderman gave me a much needed boost in my appreciation for men! I happily encounter him in my dreams! The food in LV was expensive but ohhh so good! Everything was worth it!

name: Wynn Las Vegas Casino
description: Located in one of the world's largest hotels, this casino along the Strip offers new and upcoming games, poolside gaming, and its signature poker room.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3131 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-1967

top_reviews.title: The WYNN is always the finest Las Vegas experience !
top_reviews.review: There is nothing in Las Vegas that can compare to the WYNN. As much as a destination, it is an unforgettable experience. Everything is top tier, first class and beautiful. The rooms are elegant, well stocked and comfortable. The views are outstanding. See the photo of our room below. If you have a choice - this is the absolute best.

top_reviews.title: No coffee !!
top_reviews.review: Although the casino its self is very nice (smaller - which is great) with quality food options ... The rooms do not have any coffee making !!!! I would expect a Nespresso machine in a resort room for the price $$$$ you are forced to descend to the casino level to buy coffee.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful Casino but No Blackjack Tables with Less Than a $100 Minimum
top_reviews.review: The Wynn is undoubtedly a beautiful and elegant hotel and casino. I stopped in and was looking forward to spending some time in the casino playing Blackjack in this stunning setting. However, when I discovered there wasn't a table with under a $100 minimum, I headed for the exit. I may be an idiot at times, but I'm no fool.

top_reviews.title: Glad to find different versions of crapless craps machines here
top_reviews.review: So I hadnât visited the Wynn casino ever since itâs opening mainly for the reason Iâm a low budget gambler. Anyways what prompted me to visit the property was mgmâs tier matching proposal. So upon getting the players card I started wandering around the property and found many versions of bubble craps here with $3 minimum. Something I expected at downtown not on the strip. The machines are mostly the individual bubble craps they had multiple versions of crapless craps:easy craps, crapless craps, and the version where you select the two dice out of three choices. Great thing is it was easy to find an empty terminal.

top_reviews.title: Great feel to the place (even if I was a loser).
top_reviews.review: We stayed at the Venetian, but had to do some casino hopping of course. I'm not a big gambler, but the feel for the place was really cool. We just played some slots and walked around. It was more just a quick tour of the property and then we moved on to the next, trying to see as much of the strip and week could in just a few days. This was definitely one that you should get to and check out. Hopefully with better luck than us.

top_reviews.title: Exceptional casino , best in area . Good odds too.
top_reviews.review: Best Casino in Vegas I have tried all MGMâs too. Wynn has very few BJ tables with gimmicky side bets . Most tables are clear of distractions , tables are3-2 odds on BJ unlike MGM 6-5 and mostly $50 min . Dealers are friendly and can hold a conversation, pit bosses flexible on min max limits . The whole area super clean and drinks offered frequently I even won

name: Casino at Bellagio
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3600 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4303
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 7 min walk
Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 10 min walk

top_reviews.title: Table Games - Ivy the Star of the show
top_reviews.review: We had another great time at The Bellagio on the tables every morningâ¦ Having read the table reviews I was surprised but I couldnât fault the staff of this place. From Sidney down to Tida, Ruby and Terry they were very attentive and was always our go to. However the star of the show was Ivy, a pleasure to have met and we left as friends, but felt like family. Apologies for being loud at 8am on the roulette tableâ¦ In terms of getting a drink, Wanda and Marissa were always at hand. Thanks all again, see you next year Gareth

top_reviews.title: Enjoyable Playtime!
top_reviews.review: We spent four days at the Bellagio & enjoyed playtime every day! plus we were able to stay within our budget! Overall the staff were friendly & were able to get free drinks during our playtime. Enjoyed every day we were here!

top_reviews.title: Lively, beautiful place.
top_reviews.review: The casino area is gorgeous. You get a good amount of people walking around dressed up, as opposed to the standard Midwest tourist (like me). I actually won a little. The whole property is beautiful, so wandering out of the casino area for a break, or to rethink your life, is pleasant. Good luck!

top_reviews.title: Mesmerizing Fountains and Jackpot ð¤©ð°
top_reviews.review: Wonderful Visit to Bellagio Casino The Bellagio Casino impressed us from the moment we arrived with its breathtaking water fountain at the front. Inside we found a huge selection of slot machines and decided to try our luck We were fortunate enough to hit a jackpot! The atmosphere was vibrant the staff were friendly and we had a fantastic time. We'll definitely be returning. I Highly recommended!!

name: Historic Railroad Trail
description: Areas of this trail were used in the movie "The Gauntlet."
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: Lakdeshore Rd Lake Mead National Recreation Area, Las Vegas, NV 89005

name: Chapel Of The Flowers
description: Chapel of the Flowers, Las Vegas' is the "Best Wedding Venue" in Las Vegas according to the Las Vegas Review Journal and numerous awards from TripAdvisor, The Knot, and Wedding Wire. For nearly 60 years, the chapel has provided traditional, intimate and elegant Las Vegas weddings on the world-famous Las Vegas Strip. It is a full-service wedding venue, with four luxurious wedding chapels as well as a beautiful outdoor gazebo. Its cobblestone-accented grounds and lush landscaping create a variety of options to capture that picture-perfect moment. The chapel's professional wedding planners work with couples on a daily basis from one-year out to day-of planning.
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Wedding Chapels
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 1717 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89104-1301

top_reviews.title: Beautiful venue. Accommodating staff.
top_reviews.review: Excellent team who accommodated for last minute plans. We only had a limited time in Vegas and the staff communicated with us promptly to make sure our ceremony went beautifully. Thank you Chapel of the flowers for the wonderful memories in a gorgeous venue.

top_reviews.title: The Best Time, for the Last Time.
top_reviews.review: This is our very last wedding. A true manifestation of God's love for the both us. Because of this, we took great care so that everything would be perfect! The staff here at the Chapel of the Flowers made this possible. The staff, especially Song helped to turn my nervousness into laughter. I will always recommend The Chapel of the Flowers for a very intimate wedding ceremony.

top_reviews.title: Convenient for all in one deal! Easy planning!
top_reviews.review: Having everything included at one place was very convenient for us. A wedding day that wasn't over the top with stressful plannimg.They changed coordinators on us multiple times and towards the end the coordinator would not respond to my messages. We picked a day that was very busy so it did feel very rushed. We went through the tux rental which was not what we expected. But, the makeup and hair through 702 did an excellent job. Very happy with their services. Overall it was easy planning and convenient for an all in one package. Drivers were on time and made sure time schedule was top priority. Bring extra cash for for tips and add ons throughout your day!

top_reviews.title: Well Organised - Nice Venue - Watch for hidden charges
top_reviews.review: Well Organised - Nice Venue but the tipping and over charged in extras really did put a dampener on the experience. As soon as we were married the chap who conducted the ceremony was asking us to pay him $80 then went & got it off my 17 year old daughter. Then before we left weâre were handed envelopes & told we had to tip. It freaky took the shine off the ceremony.

top_reviews.title: Very professional and courteous service
top_reviews.review: The chapel was very organized and helped reduce the time and effort required in planning the event. They do have a lot of different packages and options and it requires some careful consideration to pick the right one for you. The staff were all very courteous and helpful on the big day and leading up to it. We had a lovely ceremony at the Gazebo and I recommend this location. Our limo driver was the best!

top_reviews.title: Treated Like Royalty
top_reviews.review: Simply put this venue at the top of your choices for your wedding. It was so easy to book the wedding pick the package and add any additional things needed. We had the best planner Debbie and she called when there were questions of us an also gave us suggestions. We had a telephone meeting to go over everything to make sure we understood what we needed to do and make sure the planner had everything we wanted. She was great to work with and always answered when I called about questions. She sent emails at different stages to help us complete the things we needed to do on our task list. We were guided through out the process. We were given several verbal and written instructions on what was expected the day of the wedding and what we needed to bring to the ceremony. Everything went perfectly... the limo that came was a huge stretch and it was fabulous. The driver Kevin was the best!!! He was our drive to and from the venue. The Reverend Maria that preformed the ceremony was excellent. She made it extra special and we thank her for that. The photographers were very good they did a great job. We eloped and it was just the two of us so we opted to go out to eat after and that was an add on to our package. The Brazilian steak house that we went to was supreme and we were treated like royalty our desert came out on a huge plater with congratulations written on it in chocolate. The meal was delicious. Our experience with the Chapel of the Flowers was unbelievable the ceremony and the royalty treatment all through out was above our expectations. We highly recommend this venue they will not disappoint. Thank you everyone at the Chapel of the Flowers for making our wedding a breathtaking and beautiful. Joe and Stephanie Reisher

name: Downtown Container Park
description: Downtown Container Park is an open-air shopping and entertainment venue featuring 38 unique retail shops, restaurants, and bars. Located in Las Vegasâ flourishing Downtown neighborhood, the innovative center is built from 43 repurposed shipping containers and 41 locally manufactured Xtreme cubes. Upon arrival, guests are greeted by a 35-foot-tall praying mantis sculpture that shoots flames from its antennae. After entering the park, guests discover a whimsical world of one-of-a-kind boutiques, restaurants, and bars. The park also includes a stage for presentations and live music performances, as well as The Treehouse, an interactive play area featuring a 33-foot-tall slide, NEOS play system, oversized foam building blocks and much more. Container Park is a 21+ facility after 9 p.m. daily.
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Shopping Malls
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 707 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101-5615

top_reviews.title: Very cool, family friendly experience downtown
top_reviews.review: Had been to Downtown Vegas a number of times but had never stopped by the Container Park, definitely a cool experience! You are welcomed at the front of it by a massive metal praying mantis, who spits fire at night into the air. My brother and I felt it across the street walking by! The inside is basically a mini mall with a few restaurants, bars and shops to walk around. We just walked through and saw everything in 10 minutes, but you could definitely spend some time there if you wanted to. They even had a stage where they were setting up some music in the back. Definitely a cool place to check out.

top_reviews.title: Awesome unique place!
top_reviews.review: We've been to Vegas numerous times but this was our first time venturing past the bright lights of Fremont. I regret not doing this sooner! I really enjoyed this area. Lots of unique, one of a kind shops. Very artsy - bohemian/eclectic style so maybe not for everyone. Will definitely be coming back.

top_reviews.title: A germ to visit when you want to experience something different!
top_reviews.review: I believe this is my most favourite place in Vegas - it is downtown, about a block from the Fremont Street Experience. It's where the locals go. It is literally built out of containers. It's basically a park area, with retail, food & beverage businesses, playground areas for the kids, a stage for music and some green spaces. It is lovely to go and hang out in. We had frozen rose drinks and a charcuterie board at the Bin 702 bar, and sat on the couches on their patio. At 5 pm, the band started playing and we had a great time enjoying the environment.

top_reviews.title: Check it ou!
top_reviews.review: Some really cool spots. We got a few $5 shirts at the consignment/vintage shop. Not everything was open and the weather wasn't optimal, but it was still a good time. Be sure to check out the preying mantis out front, he puts on a really cool show at night!

name: V Theater
description: V Theater is located inside Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino and features two showrooms with nine live stage productions including the award winning V - The Ultimate Variety Show a family favorite 17 years running as well as the world's #1 pole dancing class for women, Stripper 101.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3663 Las Vegas Blvd S Inside Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89109-1920
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 4 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 8 min walk

top_reviews.title: Great talentâ¦. Theater and set, not so much.
top_reviews.review: We went to the Carpenter Legacy show, the debut night of the Christmas show. Both of the stars did an amazing job. Really good. My comments are about the actual venue. The theater had an older, sorry, but shabby feel to it. The stage set was disappointing. The piano had fingerprints all over the side of it, the Christmas tree looked like it had seen a better day, etc. The lighting looked very out of date. I wonder how much better this show could be if it just had the feel of something worthy if the talent and the patrons in Vegas who come to see it.

top_reviews.title: Piano Man
top_reviews.review: In the Miracle Mile reasonable price for great entertainment! Saw the Kyle Martin Piano Man show. That young man and his band are the real deal. Wonderful music of Billy Joel and Elton John with fun audience interaction. Donât miss it!

top_reviews.title: Venue is old and not cared for
top_reviews.review: Thankfully got the tickets for free at another show in town. Seats were absolutely horrible, metal bars coming through the seats! So uncomfortable! Place felt dirty. The host was talented and funny, and the two acrobat guys from Ukraine were fabulous but only on stage for a few minutes. The rest of the show was lacking.

top_reviews.title: Avoid the front row
top_reviews.review: Good staff, a cute little bar upstairs overlooking the shops and easy access. Itâs a shame that advertising pretty much covers the pretty exterior but the theatre itself really needs a makeover. We had purchased front row seats for the Carpenters, which was an uncomfortable mistake with us making eye contact with shoes (go for at least row c).

top_reviews.title: Would be rated less except for staff on ticket desk who were very good
top_reviews.review: The venue is located within the Miracle Mile shops with a number of eateries nearby. Itâs an old style venue with tight seating. The staff at the ticket desk were very good and the show we saw (Piano Man) was excellent.

name: Vegas Indoor Skydiving
description: Experience the thrilling sensation of skydiving, without a parachute or airplane. Guests will learn to "Ride The Wind" inside our vertical wind tunnel. MAXIMUM WEIGHT LIMITS APPLY. All flyers are weighed at check-in. The propeller turns on and the air begins to flow. You dive as if your diving into a swimming pool but instead, you're floating on air, flying, riding the wind. All participants must attend our safety training class prior to their wind tunnel flight. Classes begin every 30 minutes on the hour and half hour. After class, flyers are issued all the necessary flight equipment including a full body jumpsuit, helmet, goggles, gloves, head sock, and ear plugs. Now you're READY TO FLY! Flyers enter the tunnel as a group. Everyone stands with their backs against the wall as you take turns jumping into the giant wall of air. It's tricky, so your Instructor will be right by your side holding on to you as much as it takes to keep you centered in the airstream.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 200 Convention Center Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89109-2020

name: Shark Reef Aquarium
description: See more than 2,000 animals, including sharks, giant rays, endangered green sea turtles, piranha and a Komodo dragon. This unique exhibit gives you the chance to dive with a higher concentration of exotic sharks than you'd ever find in the wild. Last admission at 7:00 PM.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3950 Las Vegas Blvd Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89119-1005

top_reviews.title: Small
top_reviews.review: I havenât done this in a long long time. Itâs ok. Several things to see fish and reptiles and then the big shark tank. The issue is the price vs time is bad. Itâs $29 a person. And took my kids and I about 20 minutes.

top_reviews.title: Excellent Value - Especially for Las Vegas
top_reviews.review: Our only complaint was that we wished there was more and the length of the walk to get to it! Loved the exhibits, especially the jellyfish, lionfish and sharks! The staff was wonderful; free wheelchairs are available for those with mobility issues (like me); and the price was beyond reasonable by Las Vegas standards. It is a long walk to get to, but at least there are benches and other seating available along the way.

top_reviews.title: Worth the price of admission.
top_reviews.review: The Aquarium was well kept and clean. For the admission price (Adults $30), there was a good variety of exhibits. Reptiles, fish, rays, jellyfish and sharks. It is located in the back of Mandalay Bay convention center and requires a long walk from the front.

top_reviews.title: Visit the ocean floor...
top_reviews.review: I have a kid who is obsessed with sharks, so we had to go. There were 2 tunnels - everything swims around you - that was pretty neat. There is a place where you can touch some little rays. There is an employee there to answer questions and direct the contact. They give the rays a "no touch" break every so often. While they are on their break, you can wander around an look at the jellyfish or octopus. There is a big observation type room with glass in the ceiling and floor. There were walls of glass - so you're basically on the ocean floor watching. Our only "complaint" would be that we wish it was bigger. It was August, so it was still hot and a little muggy in there, but absolutely would recommend!

name: Las Vegas North Premium Outlets
description: This airy, outdoor village-styled center is a must-see, must-shop for shoppers. Las Vegas North Premium OutletsÂ® features over 175 designer and name-brand retailers offering savings up to 65% every day including kate spade new york, Michael Kors, Pandora, Tory Burch, Coach, Brooks Brothers Factory Outlet and many more. Enjoy dining at The Cheesecake Factory, Shake Shack, Chipotle or our fabulous Food Court. The center is conveniently located just minutes from the heart of the Strip; off I-15 at Exit 41 - Charleston Boulevard and is serviced by taxis, ride share and the public bus.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 875 South Grand Central Parkway, Las Vegas, NV 89106-4541

top_reviews.title: NOT CHEAP
top_reviews.review: Called in here 6 years ago, and found it great for value and product range.
