This time, neither my wife or I found anything worthwhile, prices were high, and didn't warrant a shopping frenzy. We found the Ross stores on The Strip, to be far better value, with a huge selection of clothing, designer hand bags, etc.

top_reviews.title: A must for shopaholics
top_reviews.review: Excellent array of stores from luxury brands like Armani and Versace to mid level brands like Ann Taylor and Calvin Klein to lower price Aeropostale there is something for everyone. The bargains are significant. A fun place to spent 2-3 hours.

top_reviews.title: The best place to shop in Vegas
top_reviews.review: This place is located some distance north of the strip. About a 40 minute walk from the Sahara hotel however you can jump on the dueuce bus and get there in 15 minutes. The outlet has all the major brands here too many to list but I ended up shopping in Levis (great bargains), New Balance, Pacsun etc etc. There are pretty much offers in all the stores like by one get the next 50% off. Decent free WiFi across the outlets this place is massive. Some food outlets too. A must visit location if you need to shop

top_reviews.title: Best Outlets in Las Vegas!
top_reviews.review: The North Premium Outlets is absolutely amazing! It's a very popular shopping destination for locals and tourists, only a few miles North of the Las Vegas Strip. I've been going there for over 15 years and always find the best deals. There's over 175 stores from casual to luxury brands. There's also many food options available such as Chipotle, Shake Shack, The Cheesecake factory, and a food court. If you visit their website sign up for their VIP shopper Club to receive rewards, discounts, and exclusive offers. Free parking for locals w/ Nevada ID!

top_reviews.title: Very helpful with my lunch accommodations
top_reviews.review: Great Outlet, I usually do my Christmas shopping here but came for lunch today. Shake shack has a portobello mushroom burger that was very satisfying. I stopped by the guest services to assist with my accommodations and they were very helpful.

top_reviews.title: Great Prices
top_reviews.review: I was glad we brought a spare suitcase on holiday to load up with all the great bargains we picked up whilst shopping here. We found that most shops actually sold items for less than what they were displayed at, only to then get even more discounts at checkout by leaving your email. Saved a fortune on most of our purchases. The Wi-Fi was a bit patchy, so Iâd recommend downloading the Simon Premium Outlets app from the App Store before you go, as this lets you get even more bargains at some shops, such as Michael Kors. This place is a taxi ride from the stripe, but well worth it. Only improvement for me would be to have more shade to save you for the relentless Vegas sun.

top_reviews.title: Wonât be going this time
top_reviews.review: I was going to visit on upcoming trip. But after reading reviews on Google and here, I wonât and just go to fashion show mall instead. Two reasons. 1) parking is horrible experience and now costs money. 2) The quality of clothes is average and discounts are no where near as good vs regular retail stores compared to a few years ago. In that case Iâd rather pay full retail that will have the latest designs and perfect sizes, less busy, and free parking at fashion show mall.

top_reviews.title: Cooler at Hotel Pool
top_reviews.review: These are outdoor outlets. There are no water filling stations which makes getting water bottle filled on hot day impossible. American Eagle employee gave me a bottled water- so kind. The stores are the same as any outlet & prices are no better. We left and went back to enjoy hotel pool on a 110 degree day.

top_reviews.title: Shop till you drop Vegas style 24
top_reviews.review: Every designer shop you could think of at great prices. Ralph Lauren store was particularly good, friendly staff and a large selection. We've flown in from the UK and have found the prices excellent. Cheese factory was amazing, too, with the largest selection of pies I've ever seen, and again, well priced. Plenty of eateries, too, to suit all budgets. We spent around 5 hours there and didn't get bored at all.

name: Clark County Wetlands Park
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 7050 Wetlands Park Ln, Las Vegas, NV 89122-8118

name: Town Square Las Vegas
description: Town Square is a shopping, dining and entertainment center on Las Vegas Boulevard at the junction of I-15 and the 215 Beltway. The 93-acre, open-air center features 24 buildings detailing a collage of Old World and contemporary architectural styles.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 6605 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89119-3240

top_reviews.title: Great club just needs better seats
top_reviews.review: The Town Square is a cool spot with tons of entertainment and food options. The club was large and set up good for comedy. Seats could have been more comfortable though. They don't force a 2 drink minimum which is very nice. Friendly service and good prices should you order food or drinks.

top_reviews.title: Great walkabout
top_reviews.review: Town Square if a fun and popular place to visit. It is designed like a small village with a town square in the middle. Full of shops, restaurants and entertainment centers. It is free to park and walk around and has some great places to eat. Also the AMC theater is there.

top_reviews.title: Probably one of the best Vegas malls
top_reviews.review: Great outdoor mall with plenty of shops and food choices. Harder to find parking inside of the garages, but there's always parking in the big lots in the back. Definitely my top mall rec in Vegas.

name: Princess Diana & The Royals: The Exhibition
description: Princess Diana: A Tribute Exhibition combines Las Vegas entertainment and the worldâs leading collection of Diana and royal memorabilia to offer North Americaâs premiere journey inside the royal family. The 10,000 square foot exhibition includes over 700 artifacts, including several of Dianaâs authentic evening gown and fashion garments, artist installations, historic royal textiles and a collection of correspondence, gifts and personal items of Diana and the royals. Beginning at Dianaâs aristocratic family estate and journeying through her whirlwind introduction to and ultimate reinvention of royal life, the exhibition contains 12 curated rooms anchored by three standout collections: âWedding of the Century,â âFashion Iconâ and âRoyal Obsession.â
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
Princess Diana & The Royals: The Exhibition
address: 3720 Las Vegas Blvd S The Shops At Crystals, 3rd Floor, Las Vegas, NV 89158-1644
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 8 min walk

top_reviews.title: Diana' s story
top_reviews.review: A very detailed exhibit, well done, and very interesting. I loved seeing all her outfits & references to events that occurred. It gave interesting details regarding Diana's background, and was rather kind to Charles...

top_reviews.title: Great exhibit!
top_reviews.review: We (50s m/f couple and 15 yr old girl) all really enjoyed this! Itâs at the Crystals. Parking was easy and free which was nice. We did it without the audio guide and I felt there was plenty of info. Itâs only $5 more if you want it. The exhibit is quite nice. Lots of interesting photos and letters. We spent about 90 mins and I felt that was a good amount of time. The only reason I didnât give it 5 stars is that about 1/3 of the exhibit is about the royal family in general which was interesting but it wasnât all Diana. Also, most of the dresses are art reproductions made from paper. Theyâre beautiful and interesting on their own but I would like to have seen more of the actual clothing. We bought tix online and saved a few bucks. We went on a Wednesday about noon and it wasnât too crowded. Of course you exit thru a very overpriced gift shop lol!

top_reviews.title: Wonderful exhibition
top_reviews.review: As a fan of Princess Diana, I was really captivated by this exhibition. Itâs not just seeing the beautiful gowns. There are cards and letters that she wrote and sent to friends as well as personal items. If youâre looking for something to do that is different. Go see it!

top_reviews.title: Lovely tribute to princess Diana
top_reviews.review: It really is a beautiful tribute to princess Diana and the entire royal family. You are able to take plenty of photos if you want and purchase the VIP package to hear audio of everything you are viewing. We opted to just walk around and weâre done with the exhibit in about 45 minutes. Iâm sure you could spend hours if you wanted to.

top_reviews.title: Dianaâs fashion, humor, and love
top_reviews.review: Very neat exhibit with many of Princess Dianaâs personal thank you handwritten cards, history of the royal family, facts about the royal wedding and her choices of fashion amongst other things. She was a symbol of womenâs empowerment and used her status to serve, support, encourage and love others. She reduced stigmas around AIDS and had a heart of gold. Many wonderful quotes included in the display and her deep love of others.

top_reviews.title: Loved this experience!
top_reviews.review: The Diana and Royals Exhibit was wonderful. We saw Diana from a child onward, and there was a nice recap of royals from Queen Victoria onward. Our favorite was the miniature dresses display!!! Give yourself 1.5 hours. So glad we went!!

top_reviews.title: Princess Diana - the true people's princess
top_reviews.review: The exhibit was everything I had hoped it would be. Very interesting and very honest in the retelling of Diana's life. The tickets are inexpensive and well worth it. Diana will always be remembered because of her kindness which is shown in numerous cards and letters she sent to her friends and loved ones. I would go see it again. The headphones with the marked stories are well worth the expense.

top_reviews.title: A great tribute to Princess Diana.
top_reviews.review: I went with my sister and two cousins and we truly enjoyed the exhibition. We spent a few hours there looking at all the exhibits and reading the correspondence. My favorite part was all the doll size outfits near the end. I would definitely recommend it as a must see while in Vegas.

top_reviews.title: I loved every minute!
top_reviews.review: Spring for the "deluxe" ticket, which includes headphones. This was moving and beautifully curated. Replicas of some of her iconic gowns, letters, mementos, a huge collection. Topped off by doll-sized replicas of her most famous gowns, which were auctioned off for charity, at her request. Stunning!

top_reviews.title: Takes you back in time to appreciate the late Princess Diana
top_reviews.review: I took my daughter and my twin sister and have always been a Royal fan especially with Princess Diana. It was interesting to see her dresses and intimate letters that just showed her caring personality. Highly recommended for all to see! Impressive exhibition of the late Princess and the Royal Family.

name: Zak Bagans' The Haunted Museum
description: The host of Travel Channel's #1 rated series Ghost Adventures is giving everyone a chance to experience the spine-chilling vibe of the spirit world. Reality star and author Zak Bagans has turned a historic downtown Las Vegas mansion into a mecca of the macabre - a haunted museum. The 11,000-square foot property built in 1938 is located near South Las Vegas Boulevard and was originally owned by Cyril S. Wengert, a prominent businessman. Through the years, hostile spirits have been rumored to roam the halls terrorizing past occupants, family members who passed away there whose energy remains. Long-time Las Vegans even claim dark rituals took place in the home's basement during the 1970's. Paranormal enthusiasts visiting Zak Bagans' The Haunted Museum will venture down creepy winding hallways and secret passages into more than 30 rooms that rival scenes from Hollywood horror films, setting the stage for frightening facts about each paranormal pieces.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 600 E Charleston Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89104-1563

top_reviews.title: 10/10 â­ï¸â­ï¸ Cannot wait to do it again!
top_reviews.review: We loved every bit of it! My husband and I are big fans of the show we flew from NC just for Zaks Haunted Museum and it definitely did not disappoint! We bought the VIP tickets to go big and I did enjoy that extra activityâs. It really was spooky and had you on edge but Iâm a good way. Our tour guide Sabrina was so great and told us lots of interesting facts about everything. They recently added a new room that is inspired from the exorcist and that was definitely a creepy room that kept you on edge. Overall my husband and I have already said we would be returning at some point canât wait to do the tour again!

top_reviews.title: Beasts of the Highest Order
top_reviews.review: First of all, the staff were friendly and Sabrina was fabulous. This tour wasnât what I was expectingâ¦ it was so much more. I wonât spoil the experience for everyone else but there are items here you simply wonât see anywhere else due to rarity. These arenât mass produced items. They are limited and mostly 1/1. I have no doubt there are millions of dollars invested into this tour. If youâre into dark tourism, this is a must see. I was feeling a little down about my trip to Las Vegas and decided to book this tour for my last day before I drive to California. It definitely turned the whole trip around. Iâll be back!

top_reviews.title: Horror Buff Approval!
top_reviews.review: If you love Horror and all that come with it, I recommend this museum. I thought like some attractions in Vegas I wouldn't get my money's worth, but the RIP tour was totally worth every cent! I highly recommend this experience.

top_reviews.title: Zac bagins
top_reviews.review: We are fans of zacs TV shows. $14 by uber from the strip. Loads of stuff that you may have seen on the show. Guided tour with facts on items being shown. Really cool place. 2 hour tour. Might be worth pre booking as they have limited standby tickets. Do not attempt to walk from the strip as its a bit sketchy.

top_reviews.title: Hauntingly great experience
top_reviews.review: As my brother and I are devout fans of the macabre, we definitely recommend this experience. So many things to take in. From real-life recordings of exorcisms, Peggy the doll, a haunted rocker, articles from the Demon House, evil clowns, serial killers, Jack Kevorkian's death van, James Dean's Little Bastard and of course the dark basement where satanic rituals were held, My brother loved the dybbuk box at the end. Zach Bagan's Museum does not disappoint. The dark, somewhat misty atmosphere and costumed guides add to the sense of dread around every corner. The only negatives were that 2 & 1/2 hours of standing in very warm conditions were a bit much for myself and my brother. There are no breaks, nor any place to sit down. Also, not sure that the RIP experience was worth the upgrade. Did love the T-shirt at the end though. Nice, albeit small gift shop. Would do tour again, just would check my purse so I wouldn't have to carry it, and bring a towel to wipe the sweat off myself from time to time.

top_reviews.title: One of Peggyâs attached customers gives Zacâs Bagins Haunted Ghost Museum 5 stars!
top_reviews.review: The Wife, Nephew, & I flew into Vegas from Oregon for the Vegas Drag Races and to see Zac Bagins Ghost Museum. Our cousin is good Friends with Aaron on Ghost Adventures and The Wife and I absolutely Love the show! Before the tour starts you sign a waiver and now I know why! During the Tour thereâs a 2 headed calf in a barn that I was standing next to and I felt a static pressure push on my left leg! I reached down to swoosh whatever it was away but there wasnât anything there! Thinking Iâm crazy I stood back up normal not to interrupt the group! Again it happened but this time was a static light grab! Creepy! As you go through the tour pay attention to your group your mixed with for almost everyone seems to have the random con web feelings touch them and they move their hands to that affected area! We paid the extra 30 bucks which was worth it till the end of our tour! The bigger woman Tour Guide with glasses was extremely rude! I thanked her and she didnât even acknowledge me. Thinking she didnât hear me I stepped back in to thank her and to have a good night and she looked at me and looked away! Other then that rude employee and kinda steep on the 80 bucks for the tour what the Hell Iâd pay 80 again! Iâm a hard one to please but Iâd give the Ghost Museum 5 stars! Well done Zac! Oh! Yes something has attracted itself to me! Thinking itâs Peggy the Doll but not sure! Headaches starting and growling in my dreams which is why I woke up at 12:51 am filling out this review! Oh one more thing! When your standing in the taxidermy room of animals look extra closely at the Birds Eye in the right corner! I swear I saw it move! Enjoy!

top_reviews.title: Zak Bagans The Haunted Museum - If you don't pay extra - they let you and everyone else know!
top_reviews.review: The tour itself was very informative and the information and exhibits made it worth the price of the general admission. We did not do the RIP as the cost was about $40 more per person and that was beyond our budget. Our first tour guide was great! During the experience you will be handed off to several tour guides, some great, some downright rude. The biggest issue we had is their constant need to point out to us and everyone in our group (13 people) that we did NOT purchase the RIP advanced experience. Instead of having a group for general admission and one for the advanced experience, we were constantly singled out, told to wait behind, don't look at an exhibit. this is not for you. We were embarrassed as this was done at least 5-6 times during the 3 hour tour. A three hour tour which is all walking, there is no place to sit, and you are told not to lean on anything. No bathroom breaks and at one point you are given the option to drink from a water cooler, but could not take drinks along the tour. In some rooms it was very hot, stuffy and we had to pile into some rooms where you had to shift just so a door could close. Towards the end of the tour, they got backed up and our guide had to leave us to assist others. As with most tours when completed you are asked to pass an area where you can give a tip, of the 13 people in our group, only one person left a tip! We started our our at 6pm and it ended after a bit over 3 hours, when we went to leave we were told we had to exit around the building as the parking lot was now locked. Overall we were very disappointed for a trip that we had planned months for, we came to Las Vegas from Texas specifically for this tour, and left feeling embarrassed, annoyed tired, hot and with headaches from the scents they force into the rooms. The property is in a less than desirable area (no fault of theirs as it is where the haunted house is located but beware, lots of homeless people around), when we first arrived there we were excited to find parking in front, only to be told no, we cant park there, its for a private party (no signs up, we were told after we parked that we had to go around the block and park in back) there is not enough parking in their spots so they directed us to the parking next door and said that hopefully it will not get towed as they do not own the whole lot.

top_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!!
top_reviews.review: I have been a fan of Zak and Ghost Adventures for many years and going to Vegas for the first time, I had to see the museum! I was surprised as to how many items he had. My favorite is the celebrity room. The serial killer rooms made me sad and I thought about it for days. We didn't have to wait and the guides were great! The hallways made me hot and the only thing that would have made this a perfect trip is if Zak himself were there!~

top_reviews.title: CREEPY but amazing experience
top_reviews.review: It was honestly the best scary thing Iâve ever experienced in my life. I remember being in the hallway of the basement when the tourist was talking to the group of people I was all the way in the back and then I heard someone say something in the hallway and when I turned to look back no one was there. My bf just said to keep walking. I was so scared because he had heard it too. And I knew I wasnât hearing things. Then I felt something kept touching my leg in some of the rooms. Felt nauseous and dizzy and I wanted to throw up. But for some reason being in that ritual basement after we had left the basement and the museum itself â¦ I wanted to go back into that basement and stay there. Like something wanted me to stay and never leave.

top_reviews.title: Adventure
top_reviews.review: I've always been a big fan of ghost adventures and finally seeing the museum was awesome. The staff were very kind, energetic, and made the experience that much better. It was my first time being there, and I do plan to go again some day.

name: Ph Live At Planet Hollywood
description: Experience the epicenter of A-list entertainment in Las Vegas when you visit the PH Live at Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino. Concertgoers will enjoy phenomenal sound and performances from today's hottest musical acts in Las Vegas' premier theater.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3667 Las Vegas Blvd South Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4331
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 5 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 9 min walk

top_reviews.title: A top tier mid-size venue
top_reviews.review: A mid-size venue at 7,000 seats Bakkt Theater hosts the sort of act that can't fill T-Mobile but runs too big for Cosmo or The Palms, an apt description for Alice in Chains who benefited from premium acoustics across 2 hours on October 10th. Tucked at the center of Planet Hollywood both entry and exit were effortless while ushers were ubiquitous but not once obtrusive. Not quite on par with The Joint, but certainly a great place to see a show.

top_reviews.title: A Blast at Keith Urban!
top_reviews.review: Everytime I see Keith Urban I am so happy I did! He puts on such an energetic show everytime. He plays so many of his hits, I never want the show to end, I just want him to keep going. I love how he interacts with the audience, he even stays after the show to sign autographs for those on the floor. He always seems like he is genuinely having a great time. He also gives off the vibes that he is truly appreciative that people took the time to come to his show, he seems like such a great person. I would see him everytime I have the chance because itâs always a solid show!

top_reviews.title: Probably won't be back
top_reviews.review: Good theatre for feeling like you're close, but the acoustics were horrible and was hard to hear. Been to Keith Urban multiple times, but this show was boring and quiet. Left halfway through. Sad we wasted money on it on my birthday.

top_reviews.title: Miranda Rocks!
top_reviews.review: Miranda was AWESOME! I really liked the theater venue. My husband and I got there early thinking it would take some time to get in, but security was smooth and easy. We were row R and still saw everything easily. Miranda came out and sang all my old fave and new ones too. I loved the lights, fire, and video. I could hear everything perfectly. I would not hesitate to come back here for a concert.

name: The Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian Resort
description: Discover Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian Resort, an enchanting shopping and dining destination in the heart of The Venetian Resort on the Las Vegas Strip. Stroll cobblestone walkways with illuminated, painted-sky ceilings, exploring award-winning flavors and signature shopping. Grand Canal Shoppes is also now home to exclusive, unique experiences sure to create lasting memories, such as KAMU Ultra Karaoke; Museum of Dream Space; and Madame Tussauds.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
The Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian Resort
address: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd S Suite 2600, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8910
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 7 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 10 min walk

top_reviews.title: Beautiful place! Bougie but pretty
top_reviews.review: The shops were pretty expensive and bougie for my taste, but thereâs no denying how beautiful this place is! I canât wait to go back and take my fiance (will be wife at this point) on a gondola ride. Thereâs also some very good restaurant options here that Iâm stoked to go back and try. I definitely recommend walking through this hotel ESPECIALLY if youâre trying to get to The Sphere.

top_reviews.title: You have just got to go
top_reviews.review: OMG absolutely amazing. What a place to visitâ¦ and itâs a shopping centre. Absolutely stunning, thought it was going to be another casino.. cannot recommend this highly enough. The decor is beautiful just like Venice.. I just canât believe how good it is the place is closed in with an artificial roof so authentic.

top_reviews.title: A good way to spend an hour or so.
top_reviews.review: We used trip advisor reviews as a guide and spent a couple of hours here. There is a good variety of shops for window shopping and possible purchases. A mix of the unusual, the expensive, the cheap and the blingy all in a surreal Venetian waterway. There are a few restaurants too and lots of photo opportunities.

top_reviews.title: Expensive Shopping but Highlight is a Visit to St Mark's Square
top_reviews.review: The Grand Canal Shoppes at the Venetian is an upscale shopping mall filled with expensive stores. It is worth a look as you make your way to the re-creation of St Mark's Square. This re-creation which includes gondolas on canals is quite remarkable and very beautiful. You really feel like you're outdoors. It is Vegas kitsch at its very best. Gondola rides are available but, in my opinion, not worth it at $39 per person for a 10-minute ride. A gondola ride in the real Venice would be a bucket list item but not so much here. I think you can enjoy the experience of visiting the Venetian by just strolling about, grabbing a gelato, doing some window shopping and watching the gondolas and any entertainment that is offered. Beware that this area can get mobbed with people so I would suggest visiting early in the day before the crowds build. It is also extremely difficult to find your way to the square and more importantly, how to find your way out. It is quite a maze and not well marked which I suspect is intentional as it keeps you trapped longer.

top_reviews.title: Visited here winter 2023.
top_reviews.review: Very beautiful inside, especially with the painted ceiling looking like blue sky with clouds. It was a lovely walk, going alongside the canal and passing many exclusive shops and small restaurants. The grand piazza area was nice, with the painted facade of buildings. Lots of diners, and several places to buy food. At canal, Gondoliers passed-by, here and there, and one fellow was singing. Would recommend this place!

top_reviews.title: Great Grand Canyon
top_reviews.review: It was amazing and comedy on bus tour The guy was hilarious. We have so much fun great time Great locationâ¦ Bus driver lady was vary nice ðð» good location food being serve breakfast and barbecue lunch. It was wonderful. I really recommend the book this comedy and a joke with Ian.

top_reviews.title: we had a great time walking around and window shopping.
top_reviews.review: In my opinion, the Venetian and Caesars have the best malls. That's not exactly breaking news, but both locations have a really good feel ("vibe") while you are walking around. It's a great place to people watch, especially watching people on their gondola rides. The shy and storefronts really do make you feel like you are outside shopping.

top_reviews.title: Worth the experience
top_reviews.review: So many shops and options. You forget what time of day it is because it looks like daytime all the time. It's very easy to get lost and end up walking for hours if you aren't careful. There's a lot of clothing and merchandise based shops and the food locations tend to be grouped together.

top_reviews.title: Amazing Summer Escape at Venetian Resort!!!
top_reviews.review: My visit to Venetian Resort in Vegas on summer was filled with the charm of Venice The gondola rides along the canals and the stunning architecture transported me to another world. The fountains were a highlight especially under the summer sun Inside the casino offered a luxurious retreat with plenty of excitement. Exploring the Grand Canal Shoppes was a delightful with upscale shops and fantastic dining options the Venetian Resort made my summer trip unforgettable will definitely recommend it for anyone visiting Vegas on Summer!

top_reviews.title: Upgrades in progress, a great place to shop for a cute outfit, or just to get a drink and hang out in the A/C,
top_reviews.review: There are a lot of nice shops. Right now there is a lot of construction going on, but you can still walk through and visit many mid-range shops (which I prefer) and get snacks or drinks. It is a fairly big indoor shopping space on the strip. It is actually a lot nicer than 4 or 5 years ago as it has more stores and is brighter and more fun to shop in.

name: SeaQuest
description: Immerse yourself in a world of discovery as SeaQuest Las Vegas takes you on an adventure through rainforests, deserts and the depths of the seas. With exciting exhibits and activities for families and children of all ages, youâll be able to get wet with the stingrays, feed the toucans, encounter the caimans, marvel at the sharks, take selfies with the snakes and more.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
duration: Duration: 1-2 hours Tripadvisor does not provide bookings for this experience because it does not meet our animal welfare guidelines.
address: 3528 S Maryland Pkwy Boulevard Mall, Las Vegas, NV 89169-3054

name: Dolby Live
description: You're looking for the kind of performance that feels more serendipitous than scripted: where there's a special kind of magic that passes between performers and the audience - where the set list is never the same and you can always count on an encore. At Dolby Live, you're never far from the magic in one of the theater's 5,200 seats. The breathtaking Dolby Atmos sound system is custom-designed and built into the venueâs thoughtful design, delivering a transformative music experience you can't get anywhere else. Every event that is performed and mixed in Dolby Atmos, from concerts and sports to awards shows and conventions, feels more intimate and immersive. Come for the show. Stay for the live experience.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3770 Las Vegas Blvd S Park MGM, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4337
getting_there: MGM Grand Station â¢ 9 min walk

top_reviews.title: Usher's Residency....Chef's Kiss!
top_reviews.review: We went to see Usher!! His residency was amazing!! The staff here were so helpful! they kept everything in order and secure! I have a disability and they made she to get me in and get me taken care of I have trouble walking but that was no problem and they did not make me feel uncomfortable they took care of me so i could enjoy the show!

top_reviews.title: Usher Vegas Residency & Karen Sims
top_reviews.review: I'm writing a review about the exceptional service rendered by the outstanding ticket booth operator, "Karen Sims". Our trip (my cousin & I), planned to catching Usher's Vegas residency. We flew in from DC the night before and without Karens help, we wouldnt have been able to have this amazing Vegas experience. Her ability to secure fantastic tickets at a reasonable price truly enhanced our evening. Her expertise in the job and unparalleled customer service at the Dolby Ticket booth surpassed any experience I've had. Karen is AMAZING. I genuinely wish her all the best. Thank you once again, "Karen" ;)

top_reviews.title: Bruno Mars Concert
top_reviews.review: Bruno Mars Concert (12/22/23) was great. However, we were warned ahead of time that our phones would be locked up (not an issue). We were told in advance AND as we entered, that we would be able to use a digital photo camera (it had no video capabilities and no zoom/telephoto capabilities). I took 2 pictures during the concert and I was pulled from my seat so they could confiscate the camera and delete the photos. I donât have an issue if they didnât allow it from the beginning, but we SPECIFICALLY asked and showed that camera as we entered. So, while they were giving me the riot act and deleting photos, I missed a potion of this concert. Not fair to me or my family.

top_reviews.title: Yes please. Looking forward to another one.
top_reviews.review: Amazing sound at this small venue for the Dave Matthewâs Band, March 1, 2024. A++++ on the seats, layout, and sound. Only negative were bathrooms quite a hike from the section we were in. Didnât want to leave the concert to take a bathroom break. Entrance from a couple of places. Would attend another concert here in a heartbeat.

top_reviews.title: Mariah Carey concert
top_reviews.review: We were there for the Mariah Carey concert, it was a great show. Overall the venue is not bad, we had the quick pass which had a dedicated line for everything so that was nice. On the negative side, the chairs are just glorified folding chairs, they were not comfortable at all. Also we were on the floor by the stage about 8 rows back, and the floor is flat not at a decline which would allow the people in the back see better. Which for me and my GF it was ok, but the lady next to us was short and she did not enjoy the show at all, she had to be on the aisle most of the show to be able to see. It was easy to get in and out, just take the Aria Tram.

top_reviews.title: 5 Stars across the Board!
top_reviews.review: The staff at Dolby Live has made our third visit (Los Bukis May 3rd) unforgettable. A friendly African American mature woman on the 2nd and 3rd floors by the escalators consistently greets us and assists us to our seats. Furthermore, the two employees in the picture offered exceptional guest service. The venue has no bad seats and the sound quality is incredible, so we will definitely return.

top_reviews.title: Excellent Venue !!
top_reviews.review: We had tickets to Bruno Mars and loved every minute of it. The venue itself isnât overly large and we had great seat. They were actually roomier than most and quite comfortable. No pics because we werenât allowed cell phones in but we have great memories.

top_reviews.title: Intimate Venue if your'e going to splurge on a concert experience!
top_reviews.review: Intimate venue - it's not so big that you feel like you wasted your money on a football stadium sound. Acoustics are fantastic inside this theater - also the venue is designed well enough that artists have multiple ways to connect with the audience throughout the performances. Strongly recommend to splurge on table service and VIP seating if you're going with a group of people. It will be a memorable experience!

top_reviews.title: Go see Bruno Mars and help him pay his bills .... lol.... he will tell you...
top_reviews.review: A lovely Intimate venue. We were in the first section to see Bruno Mars and in hindsight, we would not purchase floor tickets again unless it was directly in front of the stage; I'm quite short, and as soon as the concert started, everyone stood up, of course, so I couldn't see the stage at all over the tall people, so spent the night watching the screen and not the stage. Definitely go for a balcony because there is stadium steating ie angled, if you are vertically challenged, so that you will be able to see the stage. The acoustics are great! You will be required to secure your phone/cameras in a locked pouch which will be opened at the end of the concert.

top_reviews.title: THANKS TO BRANDEN VEGA!
top_reviews.review: Branden Vega at the ticket office of the Dolby Live theater in Las Vegas was amazing. We had a problem at home in displaying the already purchased online tickets. Branden was able to retrieve the tickets in our cell phone in a few minutes. He then was able to print the tickets for us to see Bruno Mars that night. We would have lost over 600 dollars if Branden wasn't on duty.

name: The Colosseum
description: Located at the heart of the Las Vegas Strip at Caesars Palace Las Vegas, experience the "Home of the Greatest Entertainers in the World." Concertgoers will enjoy performances from some of the most groundbreaking artists of all time.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3570 Las Vegas Blvd S Caesars Palace, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8924
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 6 min walk
Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 7 min walk

name: Meow Wolf's Omega Mart
description: Explore âAmericaâs Most Exceptional Grocery Storeâ and MOREâand yes, and MORE YESâ at Meow Wolfâs second permanent exhibition, the unpredictably mind-scrambling, perspective-shifting Omega Mart. Our hours are subject to change and we recommend checking our website for the most accurate hours of operations. We recommend purchasing your tickets ahead of time to reserve your timeslot. https://tickets.meowwolf.com/las-vegas/ All Meow Wolf Exhibitions are now Certified Autism Centersâ¢
category: Art Galleries Speciality Museums Points of Interest & Landmarks
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3215 S Rancho Dr Ste 100, Las Vegas, NV 89102-8452

top_reviews.title: Hilarious and deeply creative
top_reviews.review: Absolutely fantastic! It was hilarious, creative, intriguing and a little unnervingâ which is exactly what art should do. You could spend all day reading packaging, looking through drawers and picking up phones to figure out the storyline, or you could wander through and just enjoy how weird and wonderful the attention to detail is. Itâs up to each visitor to decide how invested they want to be. We had a reservation for 3pm and there was a line to get in at 2:30, so we waited as close to our reservation time as possible. I think there are quite a few people who only wander around the supermarket part, go into the back area for a few minutes and leave. If you wait for those people to leave, itâs perfectly comfortable to walk around and explore. Take your time, go up every staircase and open every door, and youâll likely find a room all to yourself. This was my husband and mineâs favorite activity the whole week. Itâs a brand new side of vegas nobody knew we needed until we had it. Go now. Ps- crawl through the fireplace. Youâre welcome.

top_reviews.title: So trippy!
top_reviews.review: The trippiest experience ever. So many hidden doors and crawlspaces and fantastic effects, technology, lighting, illusions etc. I highly recommend maybe having a fun little puff beforehand, if you know what I mean ;) â¦.and if youâre into that. Wild time, had so much fun! My Dad had a blast too, he was like a little kid. We went in without really following the story or game. Just explored for an hour and loved it. Maybe next time weâll check out the story behind it.

top_reviews.title: Cool experience, but donât research too much ahead of time
top_reviews.review: I was hyped to go to Omega Mart after seeing many tik tok videos about it. Unfortunately, I saw a few too many videos. It somewhat ruined the experience for me because I saw so much of it ahead of time. It is a cool experience and I do recommend it, but I would advise against watching too many videos of it ahead of time. It took the surprise out of it. I would also be hesitant with what age kids you bring. Some of the experience is pretty creepy. I saw a young girl when I was there who was scared and had a parent trying to console her. It obviously depends on the child and their comfort level, but something to be aware of!

top_reviews.title: Really cool place!
top_reviews.review: This is a really cool place. There are tons of different rooms to explore, and the whole place is really pretty. My husband and I had a blast. The deduction of rating is for two things: the advertising makes it look better than it really is (although it is really beautiful and psychedelic), and the cost/value. It is a really unique experience, and I would suggest others check it out themselves as we had a lot of fun.

name: Flyover In Las Vegas
description: Flyover in Las Vegas utilizes a unique and state-of-the-art moving platform with six degrees of motion, multi-sensory special effects and a 52.5-foot- wide spherical screen that provides guests with an unparalleled flight across iconic locations and natural landscapes. Special effects, including wind, mist and scents, combine with the rideâs motion to create an unforgettable visceral experience.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3771 Las Vegas Blvd S Suite 150, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4354
getting_there: MGM Grand Station â¢ 6 min walk

top_reviews.title: Unbelievable Experience!
top_reviews.review: We chose Iceland & American West. The Iceland flyover absolutely blew my mind. It is immersive beyond belief. You truly feel like you are flying and seeing the scenes first hand. The American West film was also wonderful, but it is older and didnât have the same level of thrill factor. Overall, my expectations were blown away! We canât wait to bring our kids for the experience.

top_reviews.title: What a fun experience!
top_reviews.review: We took our children and some of their friends here for our sonâs birthday. We saw both Wonders of the Southwest and Windborne! The thrill and realistic experience is amazing! The pre-show content was my favorite as it gives you a little insight to whatâs ahead. We canât wait to go back!

top_reviews.title: Fun time
top_reviews.review: We chose to do the double ride and based on reviews chose Iceland. I was hoping for Canadian Rockies as well but the US west was paired with Iceland. I thought both were good. I love Soarinâ at Epcot and actually enjoyed this ride better. The mist and smells went along with the presentation well and it seemed like a longer ride. We also got a drink in the Lost Cactus between rides and I can definitely recommend the Desert Sunset.

top_reviews.title: Breathtaking
top_reviews.review: We purchased the double show cost for 2 people $106.00. The pre show was fabulous giving lots of history of the places you were going to see. The staff was a bit soft spoken and the couple next to us was very loud and talking over the show. The flyover part was fabulous, it made you feel as though you were visiting those places. Loved the videos post show of how they made the films, would have loved to have been able to see those in the lobby while waiting to get in. The staff at the Lost Cactus was fabulous, I wish I had gotten the name of the wonderful bartender (employee # 89108), she was wonderful and made fabulous drinks. I would definitely go back again!

top_reviews.title: Beyond Expectations - Don't Miss It
top_reviews.review: Disclosure, I do work for the parent company of this attraction but in a completely different location and for a different division. I was in the area and decided to do three of the rides. I was beyond happy with the experience of all of them. My husband doesn't impress easily but he loved this activity. It's a unique, fun experience and priced very well! I love the enormous screen and how you truly feel you are flying over amazing sights and locations you would otherwise never see, especially from such a vantage point. We loved all three: Windbourne, Midwest, and Iceland but I think the latter was our favorite. The entire ride of each is only 25 minutes. It's so worth it. I highly advise you not miss out on it. Made me proud to be working for the company that owns this.

top_reviews.title: Better than Disneyâs but need a towel after
top_reviews.review: Really great ride, the parking was a little difficult to find no thanks to the F1 construction. Be warned that you will get spritzed a lot throughout the ride and I felt like it was a little more than necessary. Needed a towel after.

top_reviews.title: Worth a visit. Itâs so immersive and fun
top_reviews.review: The FlyOver is so much fun! I got to see all of the films and the Canada Rockies was by far my favorite. Youâre safely immersed into a virtual sky gliding experience filled with movement, wind, mist, and even smells. I love it so much. Youâll forget your on the Vegas strip. Itâs the perfect mini getaway during a trip to Vegas. Definitely worth a visit.

top_reviews.title: Take a ride of a lifetime!
top_reviews.review: The Flyover LV is a popular tourist attraction, featuring a cool lounge area, short pre-show and an 8 minute main show. The main show is where this place shines. You'll be transported to a new world hovering over unique landscapes. Utilizing the 360Â° screen it'll give you the feeling you're actually there.

top_reviews.title: Kids had a great time!
top_reviews.review: Itâs our third time visiting and our experience was great! We already tried all three ride and I would say our favorite was American west! Shoutout to Ashley from marketing made our last minute purchase very smooth.

top_reviews.title: Wonderful experience flying over the world
top_reviews.review: We loved this ride, it is way better than Disneyland California adventure park, Soarin. The equipment is better the ride is better, no huge lines that take over 90 minutes. There's a cute bar there to get a drink before or after the ride, There is a tunnel leading out to the strip, and great souvenirs It was wonderful and we plan on doing it again with our children soon

name: Eiffel Tower Viewing Deck
description: An icon of the city skyline, this high-altitude attraction is located 46 stories up and is a half scale replica of the world-famous Paris, France landmark. Rise above the frenzy of the Strip at one of Paris Las Vegasâ premier attractions with amazing views. Known as one of the most romantic spots in Las Vegas, this is a must-see attraction.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd. South Paris Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4345
getting_there: Bally's / Paris Las Vegas Station â¢ 2 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 7 min walk

name: South Point Hotel, Casino & Spa
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 9777 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89183-4013

top_reviews.title: Great Casino
top_reviews.review: Had a lot of fun in the casino while the kids were in the arcade and went bowling that South Point has. Friendly staff. Casino is clean. Huge variety of slot machines. They only thing I play is the slots, but this casino has it all. Every one had a great time!

top_reviews.title: Best value casino
top_reviews.review: I have been to Vegas a half dozen times and this was the best experience by far. Everywhere else I feel like I am being gouged with exhorbitant prices and looks of disdain if you don't drop big bucks on mediocre fare and service. Minimums are $5 in the afternoon and you can always find a table with a $10 minimum. So I can hit the craps table, lose some money, but be fully entertained for less than going to a ball game. Restaurants are solid value and wine prices are exceptionally good value in the restaurants. The next trip to Vegas, I will be staying at the Southpoint Casino.

top_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
top_reviews.review: Stayed here a few times before and always a perfect stay. It has everything you want here. The rooms are comfortable and the staff was friendly. Check in was fast. My wife and i have eaten at all of it's restaurants except Micheal's. The one we like the best is Don Vito's.

name: Casino at the MGM Grand
description: Huge entertainment and gaming complex features a dazzling casino, several theaters for Broadway-style productions, live entertainers and more than thirteen dining venues.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3799 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4319
getting_there: MGM Grand Station â¢ 2 min walk

name: High Roller
description: Currently the second largest in the world, the 550-foot tall ferris wheel located at the LINQ lets you soar above Las Vegas for panoramic views of the city. Each revolution takes about 30 minutes and each cabin holds up to 40 people. The views are prettiest at night when the city is illuminated, and you can opt for a Happy Hour ticket that comes with an open bar in the cabin. Day tickets are cheaper if you are looking to save, and tickets are also included in several Las Vegas City Passes. â Tripadvisor
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3545 Las Vegas Blvd South The Linq Promenade, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8978
getting_there: Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 3 min walk
Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 3 min walk

top_reviews.title: Nice Attraction
top_reviews.review: Nice attraction for a good view of the area. It isn't as "scary" as one might think. It takes 30 min to make its cycle so one doesn't even feel it moving. The car is also stationary so it doesn't "swing" like the old ferris wheels. I would do it at night if possible.

top_reviews.title: High Roller at Night
top_reviews.review: We decided to go late evening, it was quiet and we only shared the pod with one other couple. The views are night are great with everything lit up. They take your photo before you go on and try and get you to buy the photo package after, however the photo's are expensive especially after paying for the High Roller itself, and although it is a good experience it does go quickly and we felt the tickets should be lower priced.

top_reviews.title: Great views and no line!
top_reviews.review: Loved the views! You get to see both the city and the surrounding mountains. We were also able to get great pics of the Sphere and the F1 race set up. We bought tickets ahead of time so we were able to walk right on. There wasnât much of a line for buying tickets so if you want to wait to buy them, you should be fine. Donât skip out on the pics before getting on! They were actually fun with a variety of backgrounds to choose from.

top_reviews.title: Jaw dropping sized Ferris wheel with stunning views of the Sphere and Airport side of town.
top_reviews.review: Spectacular wheel with great views of the Sphere and airport side of Vegas. You donât get to see along the strip really but you do see some buildings nearby. Nice big gondola to fit a good group that can easily see out and take some good pictures. Probably best at night but still good during the day. Easy to access from monorail and nearby tourist street with many restaurants and shops. Another must see but I would pick the Strat Hotel viewing platform over this for the best views.

top_reviews.title: Fantastic Views and Worth the Splurge!
top_reviews.review: I had a fantastic experience and would gladly do it again. Admittedly, like many things in Vegas, it was a bit pricey, but the breathtaking views of the strip and mountains made it totally worth it. The added perk of being able to enjoy food and drinks (no glass bottles) was a definite plus. However, a small tip: if you go for general admission, bring a plastic bag for your trash disposal; there isn't a trash bin in sight. Overall, a memorable experience with just a minor consideration for costs.

top_reviews.title: High above the strip
top_reviews.review: This was an awesome experience. We did the HappyHalf Hour, which has an open bar. The choices are very basic, but itâs a fun way to see the entire greater Las Vegas area from over 500 feet in the air. It moves so slow, there was no sense of motion sickness or fear of height. We made friends with the others who were in our cart. Highly recommend.

top_reviews.title: Happy hour worth the price
top_reviews.review: I took my daughter to Vegas for her 21st birthday one of the places she wanted to go was the High roller in the bar cabin. It was fantastic! The bartender was awesome very friendly and knowledgeable. The view at night was so cool and something I hope to do again.

top_reviews.title: Brilliant view!
top_reviews.review: Went on this during the day and didn't really have to queue. Reasonably priced and really enjoyable. As you go up to board you go through a bar area where you can buy a drink and take it with you. We waited about 10 minutes to board our pod. It wasn't over crowded and went slowly enough to enjoy the view. It was really interesting and there were facts and narrative being broadcast through a speaker whilst the pod was going round. It was fun being able to see all the hotels from above and what their pools were like, and then it was announced when you were at the top and highest point. The view over towards the mountains was breathtaking. This was well worth the price paid and we took lots of memorable photos. Enjoying a cocktail whilst going round was an added bonus!

top_reviews.title: Great view
top_reviews.review: We took a ride before 17:00. It was a good experience overall. The cabins are big , the view is great and it takes about 30 minutes. The best spot to view the strip is as soon as you walk in to the right.

top_reviews.title: Incredible views at night
top_reviews.review: The High Roller gave us an amazing view of the Strip. We went about 8 pm in the evening. We could see Las Vegas in all directions especially the Sphere - which was always changing and the Bellagio fountains. It was reasonably priced in relation to the other view options ( Strat and Eiffel Tower) and I feel we got a better view to take pics. I would definitely recommend doing this. You have to commit about 45 minutes - some time for entry and 30 minutes for the ride. My suggestions are to try to time the trip so that 10-15 minutes into it ( when you will be at the highest point of the rise) the Bellagio fountains are going off and find and use a 25% off coupon ( making the ride about $26 per person at night plus tax). The LVMonorail offered one if you had a current monorail ticket.

name: Dig This
description: Drive real earth-moving machines at Dig ThisÂ® Book your choice of any of our machines: our Caterpillar D5K Track-Type Bulldozer, Caterpillar 3I5CL Hydraulic Excavator, Skid Steer, or Mini Excavator. When taking the controls of our massive machines, we want to make sure that you are safe at all times. We start each session with a quick overview of the safety procedures that we require you to follow while digging. After you pass the breathalyzer test, you get fitted for your super-cool neon yellow vest and hardhat! (Beware! Your Dig is non-refundable if you fail the breathalyzer test). Our instructors walk you through every lever, button, and thing-a-majig that you need to know to maneuver our machines with the grace of a ballerina. After just a short time of in-cab training, you'll be Operating like a Pro! Come dressed for the outside conditions and please wear hard soled and closed toed shoes.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 800 W Roban Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89044-9563

top_reviews.title: Dig this Review
top_reviews.review: My husband bought me this for my birthday. As I had told him, I always wanted to drive some type of heavy equipment. I did the backhoe with mark as my instructor period it was a blast had so much fun moving dirt lifting tires period if it's something you've never done before, I highly recommend.

top_reviews.title: Great fun for groups, couples or families! Recommend it 100%
top_reviews.review: Amazingly fun! Very good value for money. Our whole experience was coordinated amazingly fun and safe by Brian. Itâs great for couples as you do things simultaneously and you can keep in touch with each other and the instructor through the headset provided. I recommend it 100%! We learned to operate a 6 ton machine to dig holes, move dirt around, and even play dig basketball at the end. Again, lots of fun and very safe. Only thing to plan ahead is transportation, Uber or Lyft can be 30-50 usd each way so take that into account, it may be better to rent a car for the day.

top_reviews.title: Awesome experience
top_reviews.review: What a cool experience for my family member who was celebrating a big birthday! He has autism and wanted to drive an excavator. Ashley and Ron at Dig This were amazing! So patient and helpful! And so kind. Ron went out of his way to make my family member feel confident and to make sure he had a great experience. Highly recommend this place!

top_reviews.title: Loads of fun to crush a car.
top_reviews.review: The Aggression Session was huge fun. I got to use heavy machinery to completely destroy a Chevy. I previously visited Dig This in New Zealand but I chose different activities and Iâve wanted to do the car smash ever since then. I highly recommend.

top_reviews.title: Grand fun!
top_reviews.review: For my birthday, my wife gave me this experience. We arrived early, and had to wait for another group to finish - a womanâs 75 birthday event with her extended family. They also have a kids area (smaller machines), so something for everyone. I did the excavator and bulldozer combination. Started with the excavator, dug a hole, moved a pile of tires (twice, as I had the time), and picked up basketballs and dunked them into a tire. Itâs amazing how precise these huge machines can be! All of this under the watchful eye of instructor Marc, interspersed with his jokes. Then on to the bulldozer: create a ditch to build a hill, then perch on top of the hill before driving over and down (you brace yourself with a foot rest on the âdashboardâ when going down a steep hill). Both machines are powerful, but easily controlled. Grand fun. Thank you Marc & Dig This!

top_reviews.title: Highlight Of My Vegas Trip
top_reviews.review: Fantastic experience!! I did the backhoe loader experience. Itâs cool as get to use both the front and back (bucket and loader). I was a little nervous- thought I might have trouble with the controls, etc. My instructor was AWESOME. Walked me through live step by step. You drive, dig, backfill, level, and then move and stack 1200 pound tires. I gained confidence so quickly. Felt like the hour went by in 15 minutes. So much fun. If youâve ever thought it mike be fun to try - JUST DO IT! I honestly forgot all of my work and life stress. It simply was a BLAST!!

top_reviews.title: Great time
top_reviews.review: I had a Great time, the instructor I really new his stuff. The whole time I was there the emphasis was on safety and having a good time. The only negative was the taxi to get there was expensive. Would have liked to be able to catch a shuttle from a central location.( would payed for that ) thanks to dig this for making my day.

top_reviews.title: Highly Recommend This Experience!!
top_reviews.review: Highly recommend this amazing experience with Dig This. Operating construction equipmwnt has been on my bucket list for several years. Dig This helped me realized this dream! I had the opportunity to operate the wheel loader for 90 minutes! I was instructed by Marc and he did an excellent job coaching me to operate this machinary with ease. Thanks Dig This for this unforgetable experience.

top_reviews.title: Well worth the smile on your kids face
top_reviews.review: My son Hezekiah really loves construction equipments and gets excited to see one. While looking at my Facebook, an ad for Dig This! Pops up. We decided to take him there with the assistance of my dad who used to work in the construction field. We were not disappointed. The service was great once we entered the building. Iâm glad they had room to fit us in because there was a party right after. Ashley was very friendly in making that happen for us. Our instructor was Heather. Heather was awesome. She was very great with my son who is 2 years old. We will definitely be back again.

top_reviews.title: Definitely Dig Dis Deal
top_reviews.review: This was a lot of fun! This is not the run of the mill Vegas activity where you sit back and watch. You literally dig right in. Who doesnât want to drive a real Tonka toy. Take a break from the Strip and let these pros show you a good time. My instructor was Marc and he was hilarious and awesome!

name: Casino At The Venetian
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8941
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 5 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 8 min walk

name: Pinball Hall Of Fame
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 4925 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89119-6550

top_reviews.title: Pinball Hall Of Fame
top_reviews.review: The Pinball Museum is worth visiting when In las Vegas, you can walk across to it if from The Mandalay Bay Hotel. You can change your notes into coins and have a couple of hours of fun here. There are some really old machines and newer ones as well.

top_reviews.title: Loved it, do not bring small children to this building!
top_reviews.review: I love the fact that they keep children under control and remove them if they cannot be respectful of the machines. It is a museum, look with your eyes and do not touch unless you're playing a machine. This is not an arcade, so yelling and screaming is not permitted, as well as running, banging on the machines, and just being disrespectful of the volunteers who are helping to run the Pinball Hall of Fame. Keep your small children home, or have them in a stroller or wagon.

top_reviews.title: Spent a few hours in here!
top_reviews.review: This was a really fun place to visit while in Las Vegas. We were visiting my brother in law and his wife who live there. Our daughters are older, 10 and 13, so they played for awhile on the machines. I saw reviews that the games were broken or shut off but I think thatâs because its a collection to view. The games that were on were fun to play and most were very cheap usually 25 or 50 cents. They are strict with food and drinks near the machines but thatâs because they are all mostly made in the 50s and 60s and want to keep them safe. One older pinball machine took our quarters and we told the employee walking around and he immediately gave us a free game and unjammed it. Overall it was a nice reprieve from the strip and heat and something the kids really enjoyed.

top_reviews.title: Great for all agesâback for day 2 of more fun
top_reviews.review: Not overly crowded and something for everyone. Adults and older kids (10) loved the different pinball machines and classic arcade like Ms PacMan and the younger kids (3 and 8) loved the claw games. To our surprise 2 kids actually won big stuffed animals from the claw game on the second try! $5 will get you tons of game play time! Most old pinball games are 25 cents. Lots are 50, most newer ones are 75 cents. But that price gets you lots of chances. We went for 30 min one day and had to leave for a show. Came back the next day for another 45-60 minutes because we had so much fun!

top_reviews.title: Pinball fans and families have a unique, low cost option to explore while in Vegas
top_reviews.review: Great nostalgia and array of pinball to play. Overall thereâs ample options to select from- arcade games, pinball, hockey, skee ball etc. ample space for people so youâre not on top of one another. As a pinball nerd I was surprised that so many machines were off or had flippers that didnât work well. It makes sense since the Pinball Hall of Fame is a 501c3 (a non profit). It cost money to hire people to fix the machines. Not to mention not many workers have that skill set, in addition to a limited supply of parts Overall good time. For any pinball aficionados, Silver Ball in Asbury Park NJ or Flippers in NC are the places to go But while youâre in Vegas, this is a great fun family option that doesnât have to cost an obscene amount.

top_reviews.title: Great afternoon spent at the Pinball Museum
top_reviews.review: Was really impressed with the Pinball Museum. It's pretty amazing how so many machines have been restored and it was fun walking up and down all the aisles seeing the old machines. Some machines were not working which was fine as the whole nostalgia of being there was great. Considering everything in Vegas costs $$$ this was a pretty cheap afternoon as there is no entry fee, you just plug your quarters in and away you go. We also got to speak to one of the gentleman who was working on the machines as my husband recently bought himself an old pinball game and is looking to get it restored.

top_reviews.title: A chance to play many older pinball machines for cheap
top_reviews.review: There are hundreds of old pinball machines, especially more classic ones (60's & 70's) as opposed to the more modern ones, though some of those too. Maybe 30% of them are available for play from 25 cents to $1. It's a fun trip down nostalgia lane for those of us old enough to have grown-up with pinball machines. There is no entrance fee. It's just a warehouse with pinball machines lined up, little or no historical information or curation.

top_reviews.title: Classic fun
top_reviews.review: So many pinball machines to play, from very old to brand new. In addition to pinball, they also have other classic video games and a few other things like air hockey. Many of the machines werenât working but there were still plenty to choose from. No credit cards accepted, but they do have an ATM on site.

top_reviews.title: A Must Do
top_reviews.review: So much fun! Very clean and tons of machines to play for $0.25-$1.00. No admission fee and it is a non profit. The woman working was so kind-we really liked her-she even opened up a classic machine for my husband to play. A nice change of pace for the strip and no smoking which I loved! Worth the quick Uber down to visit for an hour. Cheap pop and merch which is unusual for the strip.

top_reviews.title: Excellent fun for all
top_reviews.review: Brilliant fun. This is a non profit charity run by enthusiastic people. No entry fee but great t shirts to buy as a souvenir. A lot of really interesting working machines and then a lot more to view that are out of action. A great place to go on a rainy day, and a 5 minute walk to the legendary Vegas sign.

name: Forum Shops At Caesars Palace
description: This Roman-themed shopping area features more than 160 upscale shops, including Fendi, Gucci, Dior, Versace, Chanel, and Cartier, plus art galleries and renowned restaurants like Spago and the Palm. Forum Shops at Caesars Palace by L-WIRE INTERNATIONAL
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 3500 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8924
getting_there: Harrah's / The Linq Station â¢ 7 min walk
Flamingo / Caesars Palace Station â¢ 10 min walk

top_reviews.title: Shopping galore
top_reviews.review: I could have easily spent hours shopping here, fortunately for my bank balance I only splashed out a little. Even if you're not shopping swinging by this location is a must do, the beauty of the building alone is incredible. There was a show that runs, however on the day we attended it wasn't running. There are many fountains inside and out that are worth a photo stop, I'll be back next time I'm in town.

top_reviews.title: A Sports Lovers Dream
top_reviews.review: Beautiful store with a lot of really cool sports and celebrity memorabilia. Items are framed really nicely. Now a must see in Las Vegas. Emmitt Smith is signing autographs there this weekend.

top_reviews.title: Stunningly Beautiful Shopping Mall. Vegas Glitz at Its Best
top_reviews.review: The Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace is a beautiful shopping mall filled with upscale stores and some excellent restaurants. You don't have to buy anything to enjoy strolling through here. The design and architecture of the mall is stunning. You can see a life size replica of the Statue of David and Neptune's Fountain is really beautiful. Hotels like Caesar's, The Venetian and Bellagio offer the best Vegas glitz you can find.

top_reviews.title: Spectacular Shopping Experience at the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace
top_reviews.review: The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas offer an unparalleled shopping experience, combining luxury retail with a unique ambiance. One of the most captivating features is the ceiling, designed to resemble the sky and capable of changing colors to mimic the time of day. This stunning visual effect creates an immersive environment that makes you feel as though you are strolling through ancient Rome. With over 160 stores, including high-end brands like Gucci, Versace, and Louis Vuitton, the Forum Shops cater to those seeking luxury and quality. The mall's elegant decor, complete with statues, fountains, and even animatronic shows, adds to the opulent atmosphere. The combination of exquisite shopping options and breathtaking surroundings makes a visit to the Forum Shops a must when in Las Vegas. Despite often being crowded, the experience is well worth it. Whether you're there to shop or simply to admire the architecture and ambiance, the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace provide a memorable escape from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

top_reviews.title: Great For Window Shopping
top_reviews.review: We were trying to find Joe Stone Crabs and were let out at the wrong entrance by our clueless Uber driver. The shops are lovely and the atmosphere with the great decor and design are a nice way to spend some time. In July itâs nice to be inside and this is a really nice unique place. It was very busy, but we enjoyed taking in all the sights and seeing the beautiful shops. We finally found the restaurant, but were happy we had allowed enough time to see this area before dinner. I would recommend it. Itâs similar to the Venetian shops with a similar design, but this is much better with better shops.

name: The Mob Museum
description: The Mob Museum is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization with a mission to advance the public understanding of organized crimeâs history and impact on American society. The Mob Museum offers a bold and authentic view of organized crime from vintage Las Vegas to the back alleys of American cities andâincreasinglyâacross the borders and networks of the entire world. Explore the real stories and actual events of Mob history through interactive exhibits and one-of-a-kind Mob and law enforcement artifacts found inside our restored 1933 former courthouse and post office building located just minutes from Fremont Street.
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
address: 300 Stewart Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89101-2956

top_reviews.title: Definitely worth your time
top_reviews.review: This attraction has been on my list for a while. It was time to take it off the list. The Mob museum is in the former post office/court room for las vegas. The exhibits are well thought out and go in chronological order. Some of the highlights are the st valentines day massacre wall, AL capone and prohibition, kefavur hearing courtroom, early las vegas, and more modern times. Also some Mob inspired movies. I got the audio tour which is worth the extra $. Don't forget to get a drink at the underground bar.

top_reviews.title: Great Museum
top_reviews.review: Excellent Museum for all interested in American history and culture. Lots of interactive exhibits, plenty of historic artifacts. Well organized and easy to follow exhibits. Allocate at least two hours just for the Museum, not counting distillery.

top_reviews.title: âThis life of ours, this is a wonderful life.â
top_reviews.review: Cool museum if you are interested in the mob history, which I am. My husband got to hold a real Tommy Gun. My only complaint, which I have with lots of museums, is there were too many people at one time. Hard to see the exhibits sometimes. The Underground was a fun stop after the museum.

top_reviews.title: Honest and informative
top_reviews.review: This museum did not leave anything out. Itâs four stories and well organized based on time periods. Itâs mostly pictures and some weapons. They did have a brick wall from the St. Valentineâs Day massacre. The distillery experience was a lesson in prohibition and a moonshine tasting which was great. They also have some TV and movie memorabilia. Overall, a great experience. You are not going to see this anywhere else so definitely worth the visit!

top_reviews.title: Itâs a Vegas must do
top_reviews.review: Las Vegas is not just about gambling so much more to do. The Mob museum was great , learning the mobâs history in Vegas & across America. Recommend doing one or more of the added experiences . Iâm Irish so I did the drinking one. And also visit the speakeasy in the basement. Highly recommend the food and the cocktailâs

top_reviews.title: Incredible Learning Opportunity with Glitz and Glamour included
top_reviews.review: What an incredible learning experience. The staff is extremely passionate and knowledgeable about their specific area with complete timelines. The amount of artifacts contained in this museum is simply astounding. The details that is presented with each artifact is unlike anything I have ever seen. I highly recommend including the audio as part of your tour. Allow a minimum of 3 plus hours to take advantage of what they have to offer I highly recommend visiting this museum.

top_reviews.title: Interesting
top_reviews.review: I was lucky to visit during an open day. The downside was that it was very busy, but that was made up for with cheaper entry and access to some extra areas. Well worth a visit to get an overview of the impact mobsters had on the local history.

top_reviews.title: Tour
top_reviews.review: We did the speakeasy tour and the guide was awesome. My wife actually tried moonshine, so that was worth it. The items they have in the museum are very cool and worth the visit. This is a must see if you enjoy "Goodfellas" and movies like that. Give it a go and see how they make their award winning moonshine.

top_reviews.title: Special Historical Museum!
top_reviews.review: We really enjoyed going through this historical museum see all of the Mob related events that happened during this period of prohibition! You forget how things were back in time! Well worth the time enjoyed some time in the Speak Easy for a cool beverage!

top_reviews.title: A Must See
top_reviews.review: I had an awesome time here. I love the mini movies, artifacts, pictures, and even the oleâskool speakeasy. I was able to go at my own pace and taken everything around me. Thereâs sooo much information, you almost feel like an expert by the time you leave.

name: Michael Jackson ONE by Cirque du Soleil
description: Catch the emotionally-charged Michael Jackson ONE by Cirque Du Soleil at Las Vegasâ Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino. Helmed by a talented cast of acrobats, dancers, and performers who put their heart and soul into honoring MJâs legacy, the show is a seamless visual extravaganza thatâs driven by his greatest hits. Expect a medley of aerial performances, acrobatics, and riveting choreography that offer a fitting tribute to the acclaimed singer. Standard tickets or V.I.P. packages are available, which include early access, a pre-show reception, a guided virtual tour, artist meet and greet, and exclusive seats. â Tripadvisor
category: Cirque du Soleil Shows Theater & Performances
breadcrumbs: Things to Do in Las Vegas
Michael Jackson ONE by Cirque du Soleil
address: Mandalay Bay, Las Vegas, NV 89119

top_reviews.title: Amazing
top_reviews.review: Absolutely amazing. The music of course was brilliant. The special effects were outstanding along with the acrobats dancers etc. It is costly (as are most things in Vegas) but in my opinion well worth it. If you get the opportunity donât miss it.

top_reviews.title: Wow what a show
top_reviews.review: Who does not love a Cirque show and the wonderful music of Michael Jackson! Well if they are both on your list then make sure you book the One show that delivers great music and amazing dancers! Excellent value and a must on any visit to the city of entertainment!! Enjoy

top_reviews.title: Thanks MJ and Cirque du Soleil to make this dream
top_reviews.review: I donât understand really the people wrote bad reviews about this show. I would like now why you paid the entrance. The show is simple amazing. You will see the complete MJ story with the most popular songs in the career and magician and acrobatic complement. If you dont like this you havenât a happy life and you lose your money Please go if you like in MJ Thanks MJ and Cirque du Soleil to make this show. I was so happy

top_reviews.title: Real Entertainment!
top_reviews.review: There were so many kinds of entertainment here, it's hard to focus on "the show". Michael Jackson One show at Mandalay Bay was a real top level production. Some music from MJ that I hadn't heard previously, and the talent and performance was well choreographed and sequenced. Amazing acrobatics and talented dancers. Some loud parts, family friendly though. We had seats 'upstairs' but they were essentially at the same level as the last row of the 'downstairs' seating - so the seats were quite a bit less expensive. Perfect as far as sightlines go. No real need to ante up for the most expensive seats in the house unless you really need to be close up. Because there's so much going on during the show, it was great to be able to see the entire stage - and since the cast uses the entire theater as part of their stage - the ability to see what's coming in from above and down the aisles makes a much better viewing situation. Sitting any closer and we'd have missed quite a bit of what was going on in the show. To be clear, almost the entire theater is the stage.

top_reviews.title: Michael Miracle on Stage
top_reviews.review: I was lucky enough to be invited by an old friend to the Michael Jackson Circus show. The show did not disappoint. As a long time fan of Jackson I was thrilled to see the complexity of the dances on offer in this illustrious show. The music, the tempo everything was like a brushstroke of Picasso. Bravo!
